questions.question: You are performing a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) for an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) company and needs to identify threats to the organization. Of the following, which is LEAST likely to be considered a threat to your organization?

choices.text: Wireless networks are protected using Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Wireless networks are protected using Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP)

Since Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) is considered weak and insecure, it introduces a vulnerability, not a threat. The International Organization for Standardization and the International Electrotechnical Commission define a threat as a potential cause of an unwanted incident that may result in harm to a system or organization.

Disgruntled employees, terrorists, and tornadoes are all forms of threats.

questions.question: Liam is a software developer for an international bank. He has failed to incorporate adequate bounds checks for variables in his software. Of the following, what type of attack will MOST likely succeed against his software?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Buffer overflow attack

Buffer overflows occur when an application does not validate input data length. They occur when too much data is provided, and the allocated memory space overflows. This generally causes the program to crash, and in some circumstances, the attacker can replace legitimate code execution with their own set of instructions. Software developers should incorporate bounds checks to ensure user input is an acceptable length.

A memory leak attack is a type of security vulnerability that occurs when a computer program or application fails to release allocated memory properly after it is no longer needed. This can lead to a gradual depletion of available memory resources, eventually causing the system to become unstable or crash.

SQL injection is a type of cyber attack that targets web applications or databases by exploiting vulnerabilities in the Structured Query Language (SQL) queries used to interact with the database. In SQL injection attacks, malicious actors inject or manipulate SQL code into input fields or parameters of a web application, tricking the application into executing unauthorized SQL commands.

Command injection is a type of cyber attack that targets web applications or operating systems by exploiting vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary system commands. In a command injection attack, malicious actors inject or manipulate commands into input fields or parameters of a system or application, tricking it into executing unauthorized commands with elevated privileges. This can lead to unauthorized access, data theft, system compromise, or disruption of services.

questions.question: When discussing wireless security, which of the following is LEAST likely to be a motive for conducting a disassociation attack?

choices.text: Discover the Service Set Identifier (SSID) of a hidden network
Entice clients to connect to rogue wireless access points

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Brute force credentials

The Institute for Electrical and Electronics Engineer (IEEE) standard for wireless Local Area Networks (wLAN), 802.11 wireless networks use management frames to join clients with a Basic Service Set Identifier (BSSID). Attackers can send either Disassociation or Deauthentication frames to force a client to disconnect from the BSSID. Brute forcing credentials is not likely a motive for a disassociation attack.

Attackers may use this technique for the following:

  • Discover the Service Set Identifier (SSID) of a hidden network: If a client is forced off a specific BSSID, the attacker can watch the client attempt to reassociate. The client will send the SSID in clear text, allowing the attacker to find the SSID name.
  • Entice clients to connect to rogue wireless access points: Attackers can broadcast a malicious network masquerading as a legitimate network by using the same SSID. By forcing a client to disconnect from their current network, attackers can attempt to have the client associate with the malicious BSSID.
  • Cause a denial of service: Attackers can prevent clients from maintaining a connection to a given BSSID by continuously flooding them with Disassociation or Deauthentication frames.

questions.question:
You are a systems engineer for an organization that utilizes Hadoop to distribute a file system across multiple nodes. The write speed requirement of each node is extremely high, and the cluster is configured to replicate data across the nodes in a Redundant Array of Independent Nodes (RAIN) setup.

Based on this information, what Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) level will you MOST likely use when deploying additional nodes?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: RAID-0

Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) is used to group disks and provide fault tolerance or increase performance. In this scenario, you should choose RAID-0 to increase the write speed of each node. Since the cluster of servers replicates data itself, it is not necessary for the RAID array to duplicate data nor add parity, which makes RAID-0 ever more acceptable.

The levels of RAID are as follows:

  • RAID-0 strips data across multiple disks. This increases the chance of failure but increases the write and read speed.
  • RAID-1 mirrors data across multiple disks. This decreases the usable drive space by 50% and does not provide any write speed benefits.
  • RAID-5 strips data across multiple disks and adds a parity bit. This provides fault tolerance but decreases write speeds.
  • RAID-10 combines RAID-0 and RAID-1 by striping data between two mirror sets. This provides fault tolerance but decreases usable drive space by 50%.

questions.question:
Max is a security analyst and believes a crime has taken place. He locates the computer in question, creates a dump of the volatile memory, disconnects the computer from the network, and physically removes the computer. He creates chain-of-custody documents for the collected evidence and analyzes the hard drive's contents with another computer.

Of the following, what is the biggest mistake Max made?

choices.text: Creating the chain-of-custody documents after the evidence has already been collected

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Analyzing the hard drive's contents

When investigating computer crimes, an investigator should never use the original evidence. Instead, a bit-by-bit copy of the original drive should be created and used for the investigation. If an investigator taints the original evidence, it may be dismissed in court. Original evidence should always be collected and documented using a chain of custody; however, tainting the original evidence is more detrimental to a criminal case than forgetting to create a chain of custody.

questions.question: Of the following, what BEST prevents plaintext patterns from being observed in the ciphertext?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Initialization Vector (IV)

An Initialization Vector (IV) is a random value used with a key to encrypt or decrypt data. The IV is used to reduce the likelihood of the same plaintext patterns from being found in the ciphertext. The IV is used to randomize the plaintext before it is encrypted with the symmetric key. Increasing the size of the encryption key makes it harder to brute force the key and decrypt data, but it has no impact on altering patterns.

When a symmetric block algorithm is used, it can be placed in one of a number of different modes. The Electronic Code Book (ECB) mode is the only one that does not use an IV or something similar. So, all patterns that are in the plaintext would exist and be discoverable in the ciphertext.

Stream ciphers do not use an IV, they function in a different manner from the block algorithms. These are very difficult to create and also difficult to implement in software properly. Therefore, in general, they are not the solution to the patterns in the plaintext.

One of the reasons Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) was weak was that it used a short 24-bit IV. This caused the same IV to be used multiple times throughout the stream, allowing attackers to find patterns between messages using the same IV.

questions.question: You are a penetration tester and have been hired to assess a midsized manufacturing organization. You want to test if sensitive information is already accidently being leaked outside of the organization. Of the following, what will you MOST likely assess?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Document destruction and garbage disposal process

Organizations often do not employ adequate document destruction processes. Malicious actors may dig through an organization's trash to find sensitive information, or they may also find sensitive information at landfills or recycling centers. Organizations that still use paper must employ adequate document destruction processes to prevent accidental leakage of sensitive information.

NIST SP-88 (Guidelines for Media Sanitization) gives the following requirements when destroying paper documents: Destroy paper using cross cut shredders which produce particles that are 1 mm x 5 mm (0.04 in. x 0.2 in.) in size (or smaller), or pulverize/disintegrate paper materials using disintegrator devices equipped with a 3/32 in. (2.4 mm). 

It is highly unlikely that an onboarding policy would be the source of any leaks. The policy contains information regarding how to bring someone else into the organization. 

It is possible that information is added to public records databases that include sensistive information but that is not near as likely as issues with document destruction.

Exterior building security systems would include fences, gates, cameras and the like. That is not information that is leaking out of the company—those are things that are visible from the outside of the building, intentionally.

questions.question:
Jorge is a penetration tester who has been hired to test the physical security of a large bank. He slides a small metal tube under one of the exterior doors and attaches an air duster can to his side of the tube. When he lets air out of the can, it emits cold gas on the other side of the door and trips the motion sensor used to unlock the door.

Of the following, what type of motion sensor does the bank MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Passive infrared (PIR)

A Passive InfraRed (PIR) motion detector monitors for significant or meaningful changes in an area's infrared lighting pattern. This can be exploited by disturbing the infrared pattern using cold or hot air. In this scenario, the cold air from the air duster created enough of a temperature difference to trip the sensor.

A capacitance motion detector contains an electromagnetic field surrounding the device. When an object is present, changes to that field are detected and trigger an alarm.

A wave pattern motion detector transmits a consistent low ultrasonic frequency signal into a monitored area to discover significant or meaningful changes or disturbances in the reflected pattern.

A photoelectric detector monitors for significant or meaningful changes in an area's visible light levels.

questions.question: You are concerned about confidential information being leaked outside the organization. You ask senior management to implement a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) program to help reduce the risk. What process or technique will MOST likely improve the effectiveness of the DLP program?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data classification

Data must be correctly classified before a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) appliance or software product can prevent it from being leaked. If data is incorrectly classified, the DLP product may allow sensitive information to leave the organization.

Data normalization is a process used in database design to organize data efficiently and reduce data redundancy while ensuring data integrity. It involves structuring data in a way that minimizes duplication and dependencies, making the database more flexible, scalable, and maintainable.

Inline network decryption and re-encryption is something that devices such as these DLP tools must perform if the data that is being transmitted is encrypted. It is not possible to analyze the data if it is encrypted through Transport Layer Security (TLS). 

DLP can be installed on the endpoint devices (e.g. laptops, desktops, smartphones). Installing it on the endpoint allows the software to analyze data to be transmitted before it is encrypted.

questions.question:
Asunta is a customer service manager for a car dealership. The organization must delete customers' social security numbers (SSN) they collect for credit checks. She routinely deletes the sensitive files from the server once they are no longer needed. During a security audit, she is surprised to learn that the auditor has recovered some of these sensitive files.

This is MOST likely due to what?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data remanence

Data remanence refers to the residual data that can be recovered and reassembled when media is not appropriately sanitized. This means a higher level of data destruction should be used for sensitive data. Some organizations destroy storage media to ensure that data is not recoverable.

Shadow copies can be created using Microsoft software also known as Volume Shadow Copy Service and Volume Snapshot Service or VSS. Shadow copies allows users to create and restore point-in-time snapshots of files and folders. These snapshots capture the state of files at specific moments, enabling users to recover previous versions of documents, even if they were accidentally modified, deleted, or corrupted.

Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) is a data storage technology that combines multiple physical hard drives into a single logical unit. RAID is used to improve data redundancy, performance, or both, depending on the RAID level employed.

Hidden file system streams refer to a feature in Windows NTFS file systems that allows additional data to be associated with files and directories without being visible through normal file browsing methods. These streams are not typically displayed by file explorers or command-line tools, making them hidden from casual users.

questions.question: When discussing cryptography, what does transposition MOST likely introduce to the ciphertext?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Diffusion

In cryptography, diffusion is introduced using transposition. Diffusion means that if a single change in the plaintext occurs, multiple ciphertext changes will also occur. Transposition means the rearrangement of data. Diffusion was introduced in a paper in 1945 by Claude Shannon. With diffusion, it is necessary to also add confusion to ensure cryptographic algorithms are secure. Confusion is added through the use of substitution, and diffusion comes from transposition.

Dilution and Infusion are not terms used in discussions about cryptographic algorithms.

questions.question: Of the following, what type of malware is MOST likely to reproduce without a legitimate host application?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A worm

A worm is a type of malware that can reproduce without a legitimate host application. Worms spread on their own. They crawl into a computer, cause damage, and then head back out on the network to the next computer it can find to infect. Viruses cannot reproduce without a legitimate host application. Viruses infect legitimate files or programs and use them to spread themselves. Generally a virus requires a human to take some action that will begin the process of infection and reproduction. For example, opening an infected file, infected email attachment, hover over an infected picture and so on.

A virus is a type of malicious software that infects computer systems by replicating itself and spreading to other files or devices. It can damage data, disrupt system operations, steal information, and sometimes even render the infected system unusable, posing significant cybersecurity threats. Most viruses require user interaction to initiate the infection and replication.

A rootkit is a type of malicious software that allows unauthorized access and control over a computer or network. It is designed to conceal its presence and provide stealthy access to system resources, enabling attackers to perform malicious activities undetected.

A trojan, short for trojan horse, is a type of malicious software disguised as a legitimate program or file. Once installed, it performs unauthorized actions such as stealing data, damaging files, or granting remote access to attackers without the user's knowledge.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding internal audits is MOST likely to be false?

choices.text: Internal audits can be used to demonstrate compliance against an external standard for government or industry compliance
Internal audits should be used in preparation for an external or third party audit
Internal audits can help uncover or identify gaps in an organization's security posture
Internal audits can be used to show due care and due diligence

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Internal audits can be used to demonstrate compliance against an external standard for government or industry compliance

Internal audits should not be used to demonstrate compliance against an external standard for government or industry compliance. This is because internal audits present a conflict of interest. An organization should use a third party to audit them when audit reports are used for compliance reasons.

Internal audits should be used in preparation for an external or third party audit. Internal audits allow an organization to test gaps and continuously improve its security program. Regular internal audits also show due care and due diligence.

questions.question: You have been asked to implement a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) product for your organization. Which BEST describes DLP?

choices.text: An automated mechanism that prevents the disclosure of sensitive information
Servers configured in a Redundant Array of Independent Nodes (RAIN) environment

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An automated mechanism that prevents the disclosure of sensitive information

A Data Loss Prevention (DLP) system monitors for potential disclosures of sensitive information and prevents them. For example, if social security numbers are detected in a document, the DLP system may prevent them from being emailed or printed.

A data backup system is just that, a backup system. Depending on the type of backup system, there may be another term for it, but not DLP. Backups are about keeping data. DLP is about not losing the data through a leak out of the network.

Redundant Array of Independent Nodes (RAIN) is a technology that is similar to Redundant Array of Inexpensive Discs (RAID). RAID is drives inside of a server, where RAIN is nodes on a network. RAIN creates a fault tolerant cluster of servers.

Heuristic ransomware detection and prevention is referred to as anti-ransomware.

questions.question: Of the following, which encryption mode is LEAST likely to provide confidentiality?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cipher Block Chaining - Message Authentication Code (CBC-MAC)

Cipher Block Chaining - Message Authentication Code (CBC-MAC) provides integrity, not confidentiality. When using CBC-MAC, the plaintext message is encrypted using a symmetric algorithm in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode. The output of the last block creates the Message Authentication Code (MAC). The MAC is attached to the plaintext message and sent to the recipient. The recipient will regenerate the MAC and compare the values.

CFB, OFB and CTR modes are all modes of operation for symmetric block ciphers. Symmetric block ciphers (or algorithms) are used to protect the confidentiality of data. Algorithms include Blowfish, Twofish, and Advance Encrytption Standard (AES).

questions.question: Which of the following statements is FALSE when discussing Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC)?

choices.text: Smaller key sizes offer the same level of protection when compared with Rivest–Shamir–Adleman (RSA)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Uses prime factorization

Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) does not use prime factorization. ECC uses the mathematics of elliptic curves to protect data. 

ECC is more computationally efficient than Rivest–Shamir–Adleman (RSA) and can use a smaller key size to achieve an equal level of protection. ECC is an asymmetric algorithm that does use public and private key pairs.

questions.question: Which of the following software development models MOST likely uses linear progression with no method to go back multiple steps?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Waterfall model

The waterfall model follows a staggered approach of rigid, well-defined stages. A waterfall model of system development contains all the steps required to take a project from conception to completion. Generally, you cannot skip or go back multiple steps using the waterfall model.

Agile, and its related method, Scrum, are both reiterative models. They both allow for, and even expect, the return to previous steps of the software development life cycle.

The Software Capability Maturity Model (SCMM) is a framework used to assess and improve the maturity of an organization's software development processes. It provides a structured approach for organizations to evaluate their software development practices and identify areas for improvement. The model consists of five maturity levels, each representing a different stage of process maturity.

The Gantt model refers to the Gantt chart, which is a type of bar chart used in project management to illustrate a project schedule. Named after its inventor, Henry Gantt, the chart visually displays the start and finish dates of various project tasks or activities, along with their durations and dependencies.

questions.question: Of the following, what MOST likely describes each step an attacker takes when attacking an asset?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cybersecurity kill chain

Cybersecurity kill chain is a term that describes each step an attacker takes when attacking an asset. When designing a cybersecurity program, organizations should add controls that address each step of the kill chain to reduce an attack's likelihood of success.

The cybersecurity kill chain developed by Lockheed Martin has seven steps:

  • Reconnaissance
  • Weaponization
  • Delivery
  • Exploitation
  • Installation
  • Command and Control
  • Actions on Objectives

Attack flow is a description of what the attacker does, they flow through the steps of an attack one at a time. However, the name for this is formally known now as the cybersecurity kill chain. 

Threat sequencing is not a term that is used. A threat is a circumstance or event  that can negatively impact a business. There is no sequence related to that.

System fault stream is not a term in cyber or information security.

questions.question:
Padma is the Information Technology (IT) manager of a midsized manufacturing organization. She is the data owner of a file used by her team and decides who gets to access the file. She decides only team members who have a valid need-to-know reason should be granted access. 

Of the following, what access control model does Padma’s organization MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Discretionary access control (DAC)

In Discretionary Access Control (DAC) models, the data owner is responsible for assigning permissions for the object. Each object has a data owner, and these owners determine permissions. The data owner can also audit, edit, and delete an object.

Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classifications, clearances, and policies to define user access. 

Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) maps a subject’s role with their needed operations and tasks. 

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) makes decisions based on attributes for either the subject, object, or actions.

questions.question:
Roberta is a hacktivist who has discovered a group of government servers that are vulnerable to an attack that allows her to flood the server's broadcast address with Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) requests containing a victim's Internet Protocol (IP) address as the source address.

Of the following, what type of attack has Roberta MOST likely discovered is possible?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A smurf attack

A smurf attack spoofs the source IP address with the victim's address and floods the broadcast address with Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) requests. This causes devices on the network to send an ICMP reply to the victim for each ICMP request sent by the attacker. This overwhelms the victim and can cause the system to crash. A smurf attack is a Denial of Service attack (DoS).

In a SYN flood attack, the attacker floods the target server with a large number of SYN packets, typically spoofing the source IP addresses to make it appear as though the requests are coming from legitimate clients. However, the attacker does not complete the handshake process by sending the final ACK packet to establish the connection. As a result, the target server is left waiting for the final ACK packet, tying up system resources and preventing it from processing legitimate connection requests.

A buffer overflow attack is a type of security vulnerability that occurs when a program attempts to write more data to a buffer, or temporary storage area, than it can hold. Buffers are allocated a fixed amount of memory, and if a program writes data beyond the allocated buffer size, it can overwrite adjacent memory locations. This overflow can corrupt data, crash the program, or, more dangerously, allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

In a land attack, the attacker sends a spoofed TCP SYN packet with the source IP address set to the same IP address as the target system as well as the same port number for both the source and destination ports. This creates a situation where the target system receives a packet that appears to come from itself. When the target system attempts to process the packet, it enters into an infinite loop of responding to itself, causing it to become overwhelmed and unable to process legitimate network traffic.

questions.question: Ingmar has been asked to set up an identity service that allows users of his organization to access cloud resources without sharing or granting access to his organization's credentials database with the cloud provider. Of the following, what Single Sign-On (SSO) technology will Ingmar MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML)

Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an open standard that allows identity providers to pass authorization tokens to service providers. SAML is a type of federated identity management and is a form of Single Sign-On (SSO) that provides a solution for users accessing resources over the internet.

Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is a protocol used to access and manage directory information within a corporation. It enables clients to query, modify, and authenticate against directory services such as Active Directory (AD) in a networked environment.

Kerberos is an authentication protocol used within corporation that enables secure communication over an untrusted network. It uses tickets for authentication, allowing clients and servers to verify each other's identities without transmitting sensitive information across the network. This is the foundation that AD works on.

Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) is a protocol used for centralized Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) services. It allows network devices to communicate with a central server to authenticate and authorize users accessing network resources. Again this is also used within a corporation.

questions.question: The information security manager for an international trading company is working with the facilities maintenance team to ensure that if an electrical fire starts in the data center, it will be extinguished safely. Of the following, what is MOST likely the best extinguisher for a Class C fire?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Carbon dioxide

Fires are classified according to what material is burning. Class C fires are electrical fires. Class C fires require carbon dioxide or dry powders to extinguish them. Using water on a Class C fire can cause electrocution. 

If the room is a sealed environment, liquid nitrogen can be used because it blocks accces to the oxygen that the fire needs to breath and burn. The room must sealed though, so this is not the best choice for a data center.

Potassium acetate can be used on all classes of fire except for metal fires, class D. It does have a problem with damaging electrical equipment, so it is not the best choice for a data center.

The following are the fire classifications:

  • Class A: Common combustibles, such as wood or paper
  • Class B: Liquids, such as fuels and oils
  • Class C: Electrical, such as wiring and equipment
  • Class D: Combustible metals, such as magnesium or sodium
  • Class K: Commercial kitchen grease fires

questions.question: Of the following, what BEST describes a clipping level?

choices.text: Threshold for the number of errors or the number of times an error occurs before it is considered suspicious
A score used to determine the trustworthiness of an email
A score used to rank a vulnerability's criticality

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Threshold for the number of errors or the number of times an error occurs before it is considered suspicious

The clipping level is a threshold for the number of error occurrences before it's considered suspicious or sets off an alarm. For example, ten attempts with an incorrect password would trigger an account lockout and password reset. It is more commonly referred to as a threshold.

Set how verbose system logs are does not have a specific term related to it. Setting the logging so that the corporation will have a record of everything that they need a record of is critical.

There is a sender score related to those that send out emails. It allows the recipients to be able to determine the trustworthiness of the email based on that information.

The score to rank a vulnerabilities criticality is called the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS). The score is from 1-10. Ten is the most severe score a vulnerability can receive.

questions.question:
Giselle is the security manager for a large bank and wants to arrange for an external penetration tester to assess the organization for potential security risks. She intentionally does not notify her staff and wants to see what vulnerabilities the penetration tester can find without any assistance from the organization.

Of the following, what type of test has Kylie MOST likely requested from the penetration tester?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Closed box test

When the assessor or penetration tester is not provided any information about the organization's network or interworkings, it is referred to as a closed box (formerly black box) test. Closed box testing is used to assess the organization's security posture from an outsider's perspective.

Open box (formerly white boxz0) testing is incorrect because it gives the vulnerability scanner or penetration tester complete knowledge and access to the network's interworkings. This is more likely to find and exploit vulnerabilities used by an insider. 

Partial box (formerly gray box) testing is incorrect because the vulnerability scanner or penetration tester is only provided with limited knowledge or access to a network. 

Zero box testing is a fabricated term.

questions.question: A sales manager for a staffing organization is visiting one of their clients. When the sales manager arrives at the client’s facility, the manager must enter a small room with an ingress and egress door. Each door must be entirely closed before the other can open. Of the following, what is this type of room called?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mantrap

Mantraps force individuals into a small room with an ingress and egress door. Before the person can exit through the egress door, the ingress door must be closed and locked. If the individual is authorized, the egress door will unlock, and they can proceed. If they are not authorized, both doors remain locked until a security guard or police officer arrives and escorts them off the property or arrests them for trespassing. It is common for mantraps to have a weight scale across the floor to ensure only one person is in the room.

A lobby is the entry area into the building. There may be ingress and egress doors, but there is not a requirement for one door to close before the other can open. 

Vestibule is another name for a lobby or hall next to the outer door. 

A checkroom is a room that often only has one door into it. The checkroom is where coats and other items can be left temporarily.

questions.question: Of the following, which block cipher mode is LEAST likely to prevent plaintext patterns from being observed in the ciphertext?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Electronic Code Book (ECB)

Electronic Code Book (ECB) encrypts each block using the same key with no additional random input. This means that the same plaintext patterns will be found in the ciphertext. If block A and block B both have the plaintext word Monkey, they will both show identical ciphertext for the portion of the block with the word Monkey.

Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) introduced the idea of an Initialization Vector (IV). The IV is a random number that is used to do an initial encryption using eXclusive OR (XOR). This effectively randomizes the plaintext before it is run through the encryption routine. This prevents patterns from the plaintext from appearing in the ciphertext.

Cipher FeedBack (CFB) also uses an IV as does Output FeedBack (OFB). ECB, CFB and OFB all combine the XOR, the symmetric key, and the encryption routine in slightly different manners. CBC was commonly used for decades.

questions.question: Of the following, what MOST likely documents everyone who handled evidence?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Chain of custody

The chain of custody is chronological documentation or a paper trail showing the seizure, custody, control, transfer, analysis, and disposal of evidence. The chain of custody (also called the chain of evidence) documents all individuals who handled the evidence and helps ensure that evidence can be used in court proceedings.

An indictment is a formal accusation or charge against an individual or entity for committing a crime. It is typically issued by a grand jury based on evidence presented by prosecutors. An indictment indicates that there is sufficient evidence to proceed with a criminal trial.

A subpoena is a legal document issued by a court or authorized government agency that compels an individual to appear in court as a witness or to produce documents, records, or evidence relevant to a legal proceeding. It is a means of compelling a person's attendance or cooperation in a legal matter and is typically issued at the request of one of the parties involved in the case.

A warrant is a legal document issued by a judge, magistrate, or other authorized judicial officer that grants permission or authority to law enforcement officials or other authorities to take specific actions, such as conducting searches, making arrests, or seizing property. Warrants are based on probable cause and are required for certain activities to ensure compliance with constitutional rights and legal procedures.

questions.question: When discussing website security, which of the following attacks is LEAST likely to be preventable by the website's software developer?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Domain Name System (DNS) poisoning attack

Domain Name System (DNS) poisoning occurs when an attacker is able to manipulate a DNS cache and replace legitimate records with malicious records. This can cause the client to access malicious servers when attempting to query legitimate DNS records. Attackers can target a client's local cache or the DNS server's cache.

A software developer should design their code to resist path traversal, SQL injection, and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. DNS poisoning attacks are not generally exploited against a website's vulnerable code.

questions.question: Which of the following organizations developed COBIT to describe goals for security controls?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: ISACA

COBIT is a framework developed by ISACA to describe goals for security controls.

The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is an international agency that creates standards defining best practices in various areas. Among these are several information security standards, such as ISO 27001.

NIST is a US government agency that publishes various standards, including cybersecurity ones such as NIST 800-53.

PCI DSS is a standard developed by the Payment Card Industry (PCI) focused specifically on protecting cardholders' data and preventing fraud.

questions.question: Lucjan has been promoted to Financial Controller from Accounts Payable Accountant. Information Technology (IT) was notified of the change and has granted him access needed for his new role. However, IT did not review or revoke any previous access. Of the following, what MOST likely describes what has happened?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Privilege creep

Privilege creep (a.k.a., authorization creep) happens when a user’s permissions are not revoked during role changes. This gives employees permission to systems and resources they no longer need to do their job. This violates the principle of least privilege.

This is arguably a policy violation, but the question is pushing toward the privilege creep answer by the phrases promoted to and did not revoke previous access.

M of N refers to the principle that we need multiple people present to accomplish something. It does not require everyone who is part of a particular group. Everyone is represented by N. M refers to the number of people who must be present. For example, a Hardware Security Manager (HSM) has keys that need to be extracted and backed up. A certain number of people would have to be present when this happens. The company could assign 10 people to this particular task over time. Seven of those individuals must show up anytime the HSM is accessed. So it would be 7 of 10 for the M of N.

This is not Mandatory Acccess Control (MAC). MAC is an access control principle that requires users to have clearance, all data to be classified, a corporate policy that states the rules between clearance and classification, a system that can enforce that policy as well as the users having a Need to Know (NtK).

questions.question: Of the following, which is LEAST likely to use asymmetric cryptography?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Kerberos 

Kerberos offers a Single-Sign-On (SSO) solution for users and provides protection for credentials. The current version, Kerberos 5, relies on symmetric-key cryptography using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Kerberos uses a series of tickets to authenticate users/clients and provide access to network resources. Using Kerberos, clients obtain tickets from the Key Distribution Center (KDC) and present these tickets to network resources when access requests are made. Kerberos uses symmetric encryption to verify the ticket’s authenticity.

Digital Signature Standard (DSS), the Diffie-Hellman key exchange, and Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) are all examples of asymmetric cryptography.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is LEAST likely to be true when discussing biometric authentication?

choices.text: A high Crossover Error Rate (CER) is essential for the security of the system
A false acceptance is known as a type 2 error
Biomectrics are part of the factor 3 authentication category
Palm scans measure vein pattens in the hand

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A high Crossover Error Rate (CER) is essential for the security of the system

The point at which biometric type 1 errors (false rejection rate) and type 2 errors (false acceptance rate) are equal is the Crossover Error Rate (CER). When a biometric device is too sensitive, type 1 errors (false negatives) are more common. When a biometric device is not sensitive enough, type 2 errors (false positives) are more common. The best scenario is a low crossover error rate (CER). This means that the device rarely has a false acceptance or a false rejection.

There are three authentication factors. Factor 1 is authentication through knowledge (e.g., passwords). Factor 2 is authentication through possession (e.g., tokens). Factor 3 is authentication through a physical characteristic (e.g., palm scan).

questions.question: Poonam is the chief network manager for an international banking corporation. She instructs her network administrators to configure switch interfaces to dynamically create trunk or tagged interfaces if another switch is detected. Of the following, which type of attack is LEAST likely to take advantage of this functionality?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attack

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attacks are not more likely to occur if dynamic trunking or tagging is enabled in a network.

Network administrators should disable dynamic trunk or tagged interfaces and use separate VLANS for access interfaces. Leaving dynamic trunking enabled leaves their network open to multiple attacks:

  • VLAN hopping occurs when an attacker manipulates a frame, so the switch moves it to a different VLAN. VLAN hopping can happen by spoofing a switch, setting up a dynamic trunk or tagged interface, or creating a double-encapsulated 802.1Q tag.
  • Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) manipulation attacks may include changes to the root bridge id, causing the network to converge.
  • VLAN Trunk Protocol (VTP) attacks allow attackers to create or remove VLANS and propagate the changes throughout the entire switching environment.

questions.question: Of the following, what control is MOST likely to detect fraud?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory vacations

Mandatory vacations are used to detect fraud within an organization. Mandatory vacation length is recommended for a minimum of two weeks to be considered effective. Organizations can use mandatory vacations as an opportunity to conduct periodic security audits or assessments. Auditing an employees work, especially those who handle money, allows a company to detect fraud.

Separation of duties is incorrect because it is a preventive control. Separation of duties is the idea that tasks are split between multiple people. It requires multiple people to participate, not all at the same time, to complete a task.

Split knowledge is incorrect because it is a preventive control. Split knowledge is the idea that information required to accomplish a task is split between multiple people, for example a password to open a safe requires multiple people to be present to each enter part of the password.

Security guards are incorrect because they act as deterrent physical control. They can also be detective in nature but not that likely to detect fraud.

questions.question: Audit logs on a computer are an example of which of the following types of security controls?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Detective

The main types of security controls include the following:

  • Detective: Detective controls help to identify that an incident is occurring. CCTV, audit trails, and honeypots are examples of detective controls.
  • Preventive: Preventive controls are designed to stop an incident from happening. Fences, locks, and access controls are examples of preventive controls.
  • Corrective: Corrective controls fix issues after a security incident. Antimalware that removes an infection or an auto-close arm on a door are examples of corrective controls.
  • Recovery: Recovery controls restore normal operations after an incident to a greater extent than corrective ones. Backups and server clusters are examples of recovery controls.
  • Deterrent: Deterrent controls attempt to discourage an incident from occurring. Corporate policies and security cameras are examples of deterrent controls.
  • Compensating: Compensating controls are used as a replacement when the preferred control is unusable. For example, a company renting an office in a building may put locks on the doors when it can't build a fence.

questions.question:
Christina is the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for an insurance company. She is conducting a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) and wants to include the expertise of her in-house security team by bringing them together where they anonymously provide feedback. Each team member provides their feedback on a piece of paper and submits it to Christina. The feedback is then presented to the entire group and repeated until a consensus has been reached.

Of the following, what technique is Christina MOST likely to use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Delphi

This technique is one of the less common techniques used and involves bringing focus groups into a room where they anonymously provide feedback. Each group compiles its feedback on a piece of paper and submits it. The feedback is then presented to the groups and repeated until a consensus has been reached.

Six Sigma is a data-driven methodology and set of techniques used to improve business processes, reduce defects, and enhance overall quality and efficiency. It focuses on identifying and eliminating variations or defects in processes to achieve near-perfect performance levels.

Kaizen is a Japanese term for continuous improvement, emphasizing small, incremental changes in processes, teamwork, and employee involvement for ongoing enhancements.

Focus groups are qualitative research methods, where a small group of people share their opinions and experiences on a specific topic under the guidance of a moderator.

questions.question: Melissa’s company has been acquired by a midsized manufacturing organization. Her new boss has asked her to build a secure Internet Protocol security (IPsec) tunnel between the two organizations and is concerned about the confidentiality of each network transmission. How should she configure the IPsec tunnel?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: With the Encapsulating Security Protocol (ESP) header

Internet Protocol security (IPsec) is a suite of protocols that provides protection at the network layer of the Open System Interconnection (OSI) model. IPsec is frequently used to establish a Virtual Private Network (VPN) between two routers. IPsec protects the original IP packet by encrypting or hashing the IP packet and adding a new AH or ESP header with a new IP header.

IPsec can be used in either AH or ESP mode:

  • Authentication Header (AH) provides integrity of the packet and adds an AH header. This includes authentication for each packet but no encryption.
  • Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) provides the confidentiality of the packet by encrypting the payload and adds an ESP header. This provides limited authentication for each packet and encryption of the original packet.

Internet Key Exchange (IKE) is a key exchange protocol used by IPSec to exchange the symmetric key between the two end points. In this case, probably, between two routers, one at each organization. IKE is not a mode.

Transport Layer Security (TLS) is a completely separate protocol. It is not used within IPSec at all. It is used to protect web browsing or for user's VPN connections.

questions.question: Of the following, what technique is MOST likely to prevent the execution of non-genuine software?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Code signing

Code signing is when a software developer signs their code using a private key. Systems can be configured to only execute applications and code that a trusted developer has signed.

Code signing provides integrity for software. However, it does not necessarily mean that the software is safe. If attackers can inject malicious code into a software repository that the trusted developer signs, it will be trusted by systems that require code to be signed. In 2019 and 2020, hackers successfully injected malicious code into a product named Orion created by SolarWinds that was signed and trusted.

A code review should be performed by software developers through the process of creating software. That does not have anything to do with the execution or running of a piece of software within a production environment. 

Code versioning is also something that is done by software developers to maintain their code.

Application allowlisting (formerly whitelisting) is related to the execution of software but not so-called genuine software. An allowlist is a list of applications that a user may add or run on their systems, but it is possible non-genuine software could be in that list.

questions.question: When discussing email security, what protocol is MOST likely used to sign outbound emails?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Domain Keys Identified Mail (DKIM)

Domain Keys Identified Mail (DKIM) is used to sign outbound emails using a private key. When the receiving server receives an email, it locates the public key through a Domain Name Service (DNS) query and attempts to decrypt the DKIM signature using the public key. DKIM is used to verify that the email was sent from a legitimate server for a specific domain name.

Sender Policy Framework (SPF) is an email authentication protocol that helps prevent email spoofing and phishing attacks. It allows domain owners to specify which IP addresses are authorized to send emails on their behalf, helping recipients verify the authenticity of incoming emails and reduce spam.

Domain Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) is an email authentication protocol that helps organizations protect their email domains from spoofing and phishing attacks. It allows domain owners to specify policies for handling unauthenticated emails, receive reports on email authentication status, and improve email security.

Simple Mail Transfer protocol (SMTP) is a standard communication protocol used for transmitting email messages over the internet. It handles sending, relaying, and delivering emails between mail servers and supports various email-related operations like authentication and error handling.

questions.question: When discussing cryptography, the concept that everything about a cryptographic system is public knowledge except for the key is MOST likely known as?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Kerckhoff's principle

Kerckhoff's principle assumes that everything about a cryptographic system is public knowledge except for the key. This has the benefit of validating an algorithm by the broader security community instead of relying on the insiders who created the algorithm. This assumption can also discourage people from neglecting to secure the keys through a false sense of security.

There is a Vigenère algorithm but there is no Vigenère’s law. The Vigenère cipher is a poly alphabetic algorithm.

Split knowledge is when something like a password is split into pieces and each piece is given to a different person. This requires that multiple people must be present to accomplish something.

Exclusive Or is a mathematical operation. EXclusive OR (XOR) is a logical operation that outputs true (1) only when exactly one of its two inputs is true (1). In other words, XOR returns true if and only if the inputs are different; if both inputs are the same, XOR returns false (0).

questions.question: Of the following, which method or utility can BEST detect and stop Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attacks?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Snooping

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is used to map Media Access Control (MAC) addresses to Internet Protocol (IP) addresses. Attackers can spoof an IP address by sending a gratuitous ARP update to a client claiming an IP address. The client will update its ARP cache with the attacker's MAC address that maps the IP address. This process is known as ARP poisoning.

Network switches can use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Snooping to prevent ARP poising attacks. DHCP Snooping creates a local database that maps IP addresses to specific switch interfaces. If the switch sees an ARP packet with a source IP address not associated with the switch interface that the packet was received on, the switch will drop the packet and prevent the ARP poisoning attack.

Network Test Access Point (TAP) is incorrect because they don't prevent the attack. Arpwatch is incorrect because it is a tool used to monitor for ARP poisoning but cannot prevent the attack. Internet Protocol (IP) Helper is incorrect because it works like a DHCP relay and does nothing to monitor or prevent ARP poisoning.

questions.question: Kaja is a Human Resources (HR) manager for a large organization based in the United States. She has been informed of an upcoming termination of an employee who works in the manufacturing department. Of the following, what is MOST likely considered to be the most critical part of the exit interview process she will be conducting with the employee?

choices.text: Review any nondisclosure agreements (NDAs) or non-compete agreements between the employee and the organization
Provide the employee with their letter of termination and the organization's primary motive for terminating their employment
To provide the employee with their final paycheck
To collect and provide the employee with their personal belongings they may have stored at their workstation

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Review any nondisclosure agreements (NDAs) or non-compete agreements between the employee and the organization

When an employee is terminated or resigns, employers should review all NonDisclosure Agreements (NDAs) and non-compete agreements with the former employee. An NDA acts as a deterrent against the disclosure of sensitive information. The primary purpose of an exit interview is to review all NDA and non-compete agreements.

The employee should have received their letter of termination before the exit interview, likely. If it is given to the employee at the exit interview, it is not as critical as the review of the NDA. 

The employee would likely receive their final paycheck through electronic payment. Again, if the interview is when a paycheck is handed over, it is not as critical as reviewing the NDA.

It is possible that the employee would be walked back to their desk to collect their personal belongings. Again, if theses items are handed over at the interview, it is not as critical as reviewing the NDA.

questions.question: Rav is the security manager for a large food processing plant used by the U.S. military. He is in the process of designing a new fence that is intended to deter determined intruders. Of the following, what is the minimum fence height Rav should use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 8 feet/2.4 meters

A fence is a physical environmental security measure since it provides security from outside threats. Eight feet (with barbed wire) is considered the preferred height for a security fence to deter determined intruders.

3-4 feet/.9-1.2 meters is good to deter casual trespassers.

6-7 feet/1.8-2.1 meter fences are harder to climb and deter most intruders, while 10 feet is too high.

questions.question:
Alex works for a midsized manufacturing organization. On the factory floor, employees use a shared login account while performing data entry. As the manufactured product moves from one station to the next, employees track the amount of time the product spent at each station and what employee performed the work. Employees frequently gather to discuss improving the manufacturing process, decreasing lead times, and the total time each part spends at each station.

Of the following, what does Alex’s organization LEAST likely implement?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Non-repudiation

Non-repudiation in digital security refers to ensuring that an authentication event is genuine or provides proof of data's origin and integrity. Cryptography is used for authentication and non-repudiation through digital signatures, digital certificates, or Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). To repudiate means to deny, and non-repudiation means that an action or occurrence cannot be easily denied. In the above scenario, employees use a shared account and can deny their actions since there is no method to identify a specific individual with an account name.

Kaizen is a Japanese business philosophy focused on continuous improvement. It emphasizes making small, incremental changes in processes, products, and services to enhance quality, efficiency, and overall effectiveness over time.

Split knowledge is a security principle where sensitive information is divided into parts and distributed across multiple locations or individuals. Access to the complete information requires combining these parts, reducing the risk of unauthorized access.

The Delphi method is a structured communication technique used to gather input from a group of experts anonymously. Through a series of rounds, experts provide their opinions on a specific topic, and the results are aggregated and refined to achieve consensus or forecast future outcomes.

questions.question:
On December 29th, 2009, US President Barack Obama signed Executive Order (EO) 13526. This EO mandated the creation of a new government-wide data classification program. The program created a new classification level known as Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). Any information the government either acquires or makes that meets the criteria of CUI must have the letters CUI displayed on the page or document.

Of the following, what BEST describes this process?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Marking/labeling

Marking and labeling is when the classification level is physically added to the document or media. Marking helps ensure individuals protect information and media while in their possession.

Classification is incorrect because it is the process of defining the sensitivity of the media or the document. Once it is identified, such as CUI, marking and labeling is then employed to put the letters on the page or document.

Serialization is the process of converting an object or data structure into a sequence of bits or a format that can be stored, transmitted, and reconstructed later. This format can be binary, textual (such as XML or JSON), or another custom format designed for specific requirements.

Media categorization refers to the process of classifying media content into distinct categories or genres based on specific criteria such as content type, theme, audience, purpose, or format. This categorization is essential for organizing, managing, and retrieving media in various contexts, including digital libraries, content management systems, streaming platforms, and media databases. The process facilitates easier navigation, search, and discovery for users, allowing them to find content that matches their interests or needs more efficiently.

questions.question: Of the following, which risk management framework is MOST likely to be used for Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance?

choices.text: Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO)
National Institute of Standards (NIST) Risk Management Framework (RMF)
COBIT (formerly Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO)

The Sarbanes Oxley Act (SOX) primarily applies to publicly held organizations and is enforced by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). SOX holds executives accountable if they are found to submit fraudulent accounting findings to the SEC. SOX auditors frequently use the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) framework to assess an organization for SOX compliance. COSO is primarily focused on reducing or detecting financial fraud.

As of 2017, COSO has 20 principles:

  1. Exercises Board Risk Oversight
  2. Establishes Operating Structures
  3. Defines Desired Culture
  4. Demonstrates Commitment to Core Values
  5. Attracts, Develops, and Retains Capable Individuals
  6. Analyzes Business Context
  7. Defines Risk Appetite
  8. Evaluates Alternative Strategies
  9. Formulates Business Objectives
  10. Identifies Risk
  11. Assesses Severity of Risk
  12. Prioritizes Risks
  13. Implements Risk Responses
  14. Develops Portfolio View
  15. Assesses Substantial Change
  16. Reviews Risk and Performance
  17. Pursues Improvement in Enterprise Risk Management
  18. Leverages Information Systems
  19. Communicates Risk Information
  20. Reports on Risk, Culture, and Performance

COBIT (formerly Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology) does inlcude risk management guidance. COBIT is focused mainly on the Information Technology (IT) department. This can certainly help with SOX compliance, but COSO is focused on SOX. The same is true for ITIL (formerly Information Technology Infrastructure Library). The focus with ITIL is IT and the services it provides.

National Institute of Standards (NIST) Risk Management Framework (RMF) would also be of assistance in SOX compliance, but it is not focused on SOX.

questions.question: Of the following, what system will MOST likely be used to correlate events from multiple devices and can be used during an investigation?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system

A Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system aggregates system logs and correlates events from multiple systems. Using a SIEM, an administrator can create reports showing access history, and it is useful for security personnel to verify physical or logical access. A SIEM can be configured to generate alerts if certain logs or patterns are observed.

Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) is used to detect and block malicious activities and potential security threats within a network or system. IPS continuously monitors network traffic, analyzing packets and data payloads for suspicious or malicious patterns, signatures, and anomalies.

An Information Security Management System (ISMS) is a comprehensive framework that encompasses policies, procedures, controls, and processes designed to protect an organization's sensitive information assets, manage risks effectively, and ensure regulatory compliance.

An Intrusion Detection System (IDS) is a security technology that monitors network or system activities for signs of malicious or unauthorized behavior. It analyzes traffic patterns, events, and anomalies to detect and alert on potential security threats in real time.

questions.question: When discussing Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) sliding windows, what are they MOST likely used for?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Flow control

Flow control helps reduce packet loss and is manipulated by using sliding windows in Transmission Control Protocol (TCP). Sliding windows change the number of packets that can be sent before an acknowledgment is required. This allows the window size to change if congestion or packet loss is detected. Larger windows increase the number of packets that can be sent before an acknowledgment is required, and smaller windows decrease the number of packets that can be sent before an acknowledgment is required. TCP sliding windows are a form of congestion control.

Integrity checks are performed using hashing algorithms, or Cyclic Redundancy Checks (CRC).

Load balancing is performed with devices that are called load balancers. Load balancing splits the traffic among the servers that are providing a service to many clients.

The three-way handshake is how the TCP connection is established. It is setup using the SYNchronize (SYN) and ACKnowledge (ACK) packets.

questions.question:
The facilities manager for a midsized manufacturing organization has been asked by the security manager to replace the locks for the document destruction bins and to use obstructions within the locks to decrease the likelihood of the locks being picked unless the correct keys are used. 

Of the following, what type of locks has the facilities manager been asked to use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Warded lock

Warded locks use obstructions to prevent the locks from opening unless the correct keys are used. Warded locks generally do not use pins but, instead, manipulate levers or mechanisms to open the locks.

Other types of locks include the following:

  • Pin tumbler locks use pins that must be aligned correctly before the cylinder will turn.
  • Disc tumbler locks use a series of disks that require a unique key to align them.
  • Cipher locks use a keypad and pin.

questions.question: Of the following, which protocol does NOT encrypt data in motion?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Diffie Hellman

Diffie Hellman (DH) is a key negotiation method and does not encrypt any data. Protocols like Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.3 use Diffie Hellman to exchange keys that other symmetric algorithms use to encrypt and decrypt data.

Blowfish, Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0, and Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) 3 all encrypt data in transmission. Blowfish is a symmetric algorithm. Symmetric algorithms are used to encrypt data, voice, and video to keep them confidential. 

TLS 1.0 does use a combination of asymmetric and symmetric algorithms. DH (or one of the variants) is used to negotiate the symmetric key. Then the most common algorithm used is the Advance Encryption Standard (AES) to protect data in motion. 

WPA3 also uses asymmetric and symmetric algorithms. Asymmetric to exchange or negotiate a key and then symmetric to keep the dadta confidential in transit.

questions.question:
CJ is a network engineer for a large hospital and is responsible for monitoring the firewall connections for suspicious traffic. They see an unusual amount of network traffic and discover that the firewall sees data link layer unicast traffic between devices on the same Local Area Network (LAN) that are not directly connected to the firewall. They connect to the switch interfaces that handoff connections to the firewall and verify that none are configured as trunk or tagged interfaces.

Of the following, what BEST explains what may cause this behavior and is a preventive control to stop it?

choices.text: Forwarding table (CAM) overflow attack / Enabling port security
Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) hopping attack / Enabling Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP)
Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attack / Enabling 802.1X on all switch ports
Man in the middle attack / Disabling Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) Trunk Protocol (VTP)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Forwarding table (CAM) overflow attack / Enabling port security

A switch references its forwarding table, also called the Content Addressable Memory (CAM) table, when sending frames out interfaces. If the switch does not know what interface the destination Media Access Control (MAC) address is connected to, it will send the frame out to all interfaces except the source interface. Once it learns the device's MAC address, it stores it in the forwarding table for future forwarding decisions.

If the forwarding table exceeds the allocated memory of the switch, it will begin to forward frames out to all interfaces. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by creating thousands of bogus MAC addresses that overflow the forwarding table. This allows the attacker to see unicast traffic between devices on a network.

Port security allows network administrators to set a maximum number of MAC addresses allowed on an interface-by-interface basis. By setting a max number of MAC addresses, attackers cannot overflow the CAM table.

questions.question: Sameed is the Information Technology (IT) manager for a large bank and has asked you to implement a protocol that enables various authentication solutions such as smart cards, tokens, digital certificates, and biometrics. What protocol has Sameed MOST likely asked you to implement?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP)

Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) is a framework for authentication rather than a standalone authentication protocol. EAP is used to negotiate the best authentication method that both a client and server agree on and can include smartcards, tokens, and biometrics. EAP can support these different authentication methods, and it can support one or two factors of authentication. Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) is similar to EAP but is encapsulated in a TLS session using a server-side certificate.

Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) only supports a password—similar to the older Password Authentication Protocol (PAP).

Single Sign-On (SSO) does not define what kind of authentication methods can be used. Since the question actually specifies different methods, EAP is the better answer because that is the distinguishing feature of EAP.

questions.question: Lorita is a system administrator and is required to destroy sensitive data that is no longer needed. What destruction method is she MOST likely to utilize in cloud deployments?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cryptographic erasure

If data is made unrecoverable by having previously encrypted the data and destroying the decryption key, it is known as cryptographic erasure. Cryptographic erasure is most likely the best option available when discussing cloud deployments since administrators don’t have physical access to storage media. To be considered adequate, the data must have been written encrypted and never stored in clear text, and the decryption key must be destroyed and unrecoverable.

Degaussing requires physical access to the magnetic media, such as a Hard Disk Drive (HDD). Since the question is not clear, it is likely talking about a public cloud. The customer is highly unlikely to ever have access to the magnetic media. The cloud provider could degauss. It is more likely, especially with the public cloud providers, that they will actually shred the drives that are no longer needed.

Purging is a specifically defined term. The United States (US) National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) defines purging as physical and logical destruction of the target data. However, the level of destruction renders the data unrecoverable in a state of the art lab.

Erasing the data is not a clearly defined term.

questions.question: Mountain Ranch Technologies is a company based in Salt Lake City, Utah. They design and manufacture equipment used by farmers in mountainous regions. Based on job titles, who is MOST likely to be considered a data custodian?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Karen – System Administrator

Data custodians are responsible for maintaining the data and ensuring its availability for the data owner. Data custodians are responsible for backing up data and modifying data access as required by the data owner. Technically anyone could be considered a custodian if they are in possession of the data. The Information Technology (IT) department is first on the list of who would be in possession of the data since the servers are usually in their possession in the server room or data center.

Management, which include the other three options, are not near as likely as the administrators in IT to be in possession of data.

questions.question: Which of the following access control models is MOST likely to be considered a lattice-based model?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory access control (MAC)

A system that employs Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classifications and labels to define user access. Every resource is classified with a label, and users cannot access resources unless they have an equal or greater clearance level. MAC is widely used in government and military environments. MAC is often referred to as a lattice-based model because it looks like a garden lattice with well-defined boundaries when it is represented on paper. MAC is commonly associated with the Bell-LaPadula access control model, which is a lattice-based model.

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) is a security model that allows users or administrators to set permissions and control access to resources based on the discretion of the resource owner. In DAC, resource owners determine who can access their resources and what level of access they have, such as read, write, execute, or delete permissions. This model relies on the owner's discretion to manage access rights and does not impose strict hierarchical control.

Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) is a security model that restricts system access to authorized users based on their roles within an organization. In RBAC, permissions are associated with roles, and users are assigned to specific roles based on their job responsibilities or functions. This approach simplifies access management by centralizing permissions around roles rather than individual users. It enhances security by ensuring that users only have access to resources necessary for their roles, reducing the risk of unauthorized access or privilege escalation.

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) is a security model that grants access to resources based on attributes associated with users, devices, and other entities. Unlike traditional access control models that rely on roles, ABAC considers various attributes such as user roles, job titles, department, location, time of access, device type, and user behavior.

questions.question: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Synchronize (SYN) scanning is MOST likely referred to as?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Half-open scanning

Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) SYNchronize (SYN) scanning sends a single packet to each scanned port with the SYN flag set. This indicates a request to open a new connection. If the scanner receives a response with the SYN and ACKnowledge (ACK) flags set, this means that the port is likely open. This is known as half-open or passive-open scanning because the scanner does not reply with an ACK packet.

Xmas scanning is a technique used in network reconnaissance to identify active hosts and open ports on a target network. It gets its name from the pattern of flags set in TCP packets, which resembles the blinking lights of a Christmas tree. Xmas scanning involves sending TCP packets with specific flag combinations to target hosts and analyzing their responses to determine their state.

Connect scanning, also known as full-connect scanning, is a type of port scanning technique used in network reconnaissance to identify open ports on a target host. It involves establishing a complete TCP connection with each port on the target host to determine whether the port is open, closed, or filtered.

Close-open scanning, also known as half-open scanning or stealth scanning, is a port scanning technique used in network reconnaissance to identify open ports on a target host while minimizing the risk of detection by Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) or firewall rules. It involves initiating a TCP connection with each port on the target host but intentionally leaving the connection in an incomplete or half-open state.

questions.question: Which of the following organizations maintains a list of the top 10 most critical security concerns for web application security?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: OWASP

The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) maintains a list of the top 10 most critical security concerns for web application security.

The top ten security concerns are listed below:

  1. Injection
  2. Broken Authentication
  3. Sensitive Data Exposure
  4. XML External Entities (XXE)
  5. Broken Access Control
  6. Security Misconfiguration
  7. Cross-Site Scripting XSS
  8. Insecure Deserialization
  9. Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
  10. Insufficient Logging and Monitoring

The following is a summary of OWASP from their website: The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a nonprofit foundation that works to improve the security of software. Through community-led open-source software projects, hundreds of local chapters worldwide, tens of thousands of members, and leading educational and training conferences, the OWASP Foundation is the source for developers and technologists to secure the web.

According to the Open Group, the Open Group works with "customers and suppliers of technology products and services, and with consortia and other standards organizations to capture, clarify and integrate current and emerging requirements, establish standards and policies, and share best practices. Our standards ensure openness, interoperability, and consensus."

Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA) is a "professional membership organization committed to the advancement of digital trust by empowering IS/IT professionals to grow their skills and knowledge in audit, cybersecurity, emerging tech and more," according to ISACA.

The United States (US) National Institue of Standards and Technology (NIST) has created standards in many different secutures since 1901. One of those is cybersecurity. They have created many documents and standards, such as the Cyber Security Framework (CSF).

questions.question:
Shelagh is a penetration tester and has been hired to assess an organization's network. She wants to conduct a Man in the Middle attack (MitM) by routing legitimate traffic through a malicious router she has set up on the network. Through her enumeration efforts, she knows the client monitors for spoofed Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) requests.

Of the following, which attack option will Shelagh MOST likely use?

choices.text: A dynamic host configuration protocol starvation attack

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A dynamic host configuration protocol starvation attack

A Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) starvation attack is when an attacker floods a network with bogus DHCP requests. This exhausts all the available DHCP leases that the legitimate server can distribute. The attacker can then set up their DHCP server that sets the default gateway to a malicious router. Since all leases on the legitimate server are exhausted, clients will receive a lease from the attacker's server with the malicious gateway set.

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning, also known as ARP spoofing, is a type of cyber attack that involves manipulating ARP tables on a Local Area Network (LAN) to intercept, modify, or redirect network traffic between two communicating devices.

A Smurf attack is a type of Distributed Denial-Of-Service (DDoS) attack that targets networks, exploiting the Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) and the broadcast addressing capability of IP networks. This attack is named after the Smurfs, small blue fictional characters, as the technique resembles the behavior of the Smurfs rallying together to overwhelm a target.
