A wireless disassociation attack, also known as a deauthentication attack, is a type of cyber attack that targets wireless networks by disrupting the connection between wireless clients (devices) and Access Points (APs). This attack exploits weaknesses in the IEEE 802.11 standard, which governs wireless communication protocols.

questions.question: A penetration tester has been hired by a large manufacturing organization and is testing to see if they can find hash collisions for passwords in a database they were able to capture. Of the following, what type of attack is the penetration tester MOST likely to use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A birthday attack

A birthday attack exploits a mathematical principle on probability. This is known as the mathematical birthday paradox. For example, consider the scenario where a teacher with 30 students asks for everybody's birthday. The odds are small if the teacher picked a specific day (say, 5th of October) that at least one student was born on that particular day—around 8%. However, the probability that at least one student has the same birthday as any other student is about 70%. This same paradox can be used to find two passwords that produce the same hash value. This is known as a hash collision.

When discussing passwords, a brute force attack is usually interpreted as trying one password option after the next at the user interface attempting to login. 

A rainbow table is a table of hashes created for possible passwords. If a hash is captured, it can then be searched for in the rainbow table. When that hash is found it gives the attacker, or in this case a penetration tester, the password that generated that hash. The question is discussing hash collisions. That is two different passwords hashing to the same value. If there is a hash collision, it is possible that the rainbow table might reveal something that is not the actual password but hashes to the right value. That is not what the penetration tester is doing in the question.

A teardrop attack is not related to passwords or hashes. A teardrop attack is a type of Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack that exploits vulnerabilities in the IP fragmentation process of older versions of the Internet Protocol (IP).

questions.question: Jessica is the email administrator for a national bank and is concerned about phishing attacks. She installs special software on all computers requiring users to acknowledge the risk when they click links inside an email. Of the following, what type of operational control is this MOST likely considered to be?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Deterrent control

Deterrent controls attempt to discourage someone from taking a specific action. A high fence with lights at night is a physical deterrent control. A strict security policy stating severe consequences for employees if it is violated is an example of an administrative deterrent control. A proxy server that redirects a user to a warning page when a user attempts to access a restricted site is an example of a technical deterrent control.

Preventive controls attempt to prevent incidents before they occur. A firewall is a technical preventive control because it can prevent malicious traffic from entering a network. A guard is a physical preventive control. Administrative preventive controls include access reviews and audits.

Corrective controls attempt to modify the environment after an incident to return it to normal. Antivirus software that quarantines a virus is an example of a technical corrective control. A fire extinguisher is an example of a physical corrective control.

Recovery controls provide methods to recover from an incident.

questions.question: What BEST describes degaussing?

choices.text: Use of magnetic fields to destroy file structures
Setting all bits to 0 and back to 1

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Use of magnetic fields to destroy file structures

Degaussing happens when a magnetic field is created that realigns the magnetic fields on media. It's one way to remove data remanence on media such as a hard drive or tape drive. This is only effective on magnetic media, so it can't be used on media such as DVD or CD discs.

Reformatting a file system is called formatting. 

Prior encryption and key destruction are referred to as cryptographic erasure. 

Zeroization is the process of destroying data so that it cannot be recovered without a great deal of work. That process could be done or at least started by changing the values of the bits to zeros and then to ones.

questions.question:
Sam is the security manager for a midsized manufacturing organization. She has been working with senior management to organize a third-party security assessment of the organization’s existing security controls. She is in the process of generating competing quotes with multiple assessors. Each assessor needs information about the environment to generate their quote. For example, they need to know the size of the environment, what type of operating systems are in use, and what existing controls are currently in place. 

Of the following, what step should MOST LIKELY be completed before each quote is generated?

choices.text: Signed nondisclosure agreements (NDAs) between the organization and each assessor
A preliminary budget set by senior management
A thorough review of each assessor's qualifications and abilities

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Signed nondisclosure agreements (NDAs) between the organization and each assessor

A NonDisclosure Agreement (NDA) is a legal document that places restrictions on what information can be disclosed and who it may be given to. In this example, Sam is disclosing information about the organization to security assessors to create quotes. This information may be of a highly sensitive nature and should be protected with an NDA to discourage unauthorized disclosure.

Preliminary budgets can be important at the beginning of the process to organize a third-party security assessment. However, due to the sensitive nature of these assessments, an NDA is more critical to establish especially based on the scneario in the question mentioning that each assessor needs information about the environment.

A review of the assessor’s qualifications is critical to perform. However, the scenario in the question is that each assessor needs information about the environment, so it is critical to have an NDA in place.

Defining the scope of the assessment is one of the first steps to perform before an actual assement is done. The scenario in the question is that the assessors need information, but before that can be done, an NDA needs to be shared.

questions.question: Bao is a security engineer for an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) company and is installing sensors in the server racks of a production data center. The sensors will trigger an alarm if their electromagnetic field is disturbed. Of the following, what type of intrusion detection system is Bao MOST likely installing?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Capacitance

A Capacitance Intrusion Detection System detects changes in the electromagnetic field around the sensor. When a person walks into the field or if a door is opened, it disturbs the field's electromagnetic properties and will set off the alarm.

A Passive InfraRed (PIR) motion detector monitors for significant or meaningful changes in an area's infrared lighting pattern. This can be exploited by disturbing the infrared pattern using cold or hot air. Cold air from an air duster can create enough of a temperature difference to trip the sensor.

A wave pattern motion detector transmits a consistent low ultrasonic frequency signal into a monitored area to discover significant or meaningful changes or disturbances in the reflected pattern.

A photoelectric detector monitors for significant or meaningful changes in an area's visible light levels.

questions.question: Nancy works for a car manufacturing plant. She uses an Industrial Control System (ICS) to press steel sheets into their desired shape. This ICS only controls the steel sheet press and integrates with multiple Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs). Which of the following control systems is Nancy MOST likely using?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Distributed Control System (DCS)

A Distributed Control System (DCS) is a network of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), sensors, and supervisory computers. Generally, a DCS is process-specific and does not span large geographical areas, whereas a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system controls multiple processes and can span large geographical areas. DCS systems are often proprietary and are integrated into existing SCADA systems.

A Discrete Controller is a simple controller that allows the operator to control the process manually.

A Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) is a controller that can have multiple inputs and outputs. PLCs are often networked and controlled by a supervisory computer.

Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems are large Industrial Control systems (ICS) that can span large geographic areas. SCADA systems control and supervise operations using inputs from PLCs, sensors, and Human-Machine Interfaces (HMI). The supervisory computers of the SCADA system use this input to send commands to Remote Terminal Units (RTUs) to alter a process or generate alarms.

Static Logic Controller (SLC) is a fabricated term.

questions.question: Multiple components make up the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP). Of the following, which component MOST likely provides a score based on the criticality of a specific vulnerability?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS)

The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) provides a scoring system based on the criticality of a specific vulnerability. The current version of CVSS is version 3.1 and is maintained by the National Institute of Standards (NIST).

Below are the score ranges for CVSS 3.1:

 

The National Vulnerability Database (NVD) provides details about vulnerabilities, including their severity, impact, and solutions for mitigation or remediation. The NVD is the databases of vulnerabilities identififed as Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs). CVEs are the assigned unique identifiers (CVE IDs) for each vulnerability in the NVD. These identifiers help security professionals and organizations reference and discuss vulnerabilities in a standardized manner. Each CVE is assigned a score, which is the CVSS.

questions.question: A network scan with the Finish (FIN), Push (PSH), and Urgent (URG) flags set is MOST likely known as?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Xmas scan

Xmas scanning sends packets with the FIN, PSH, and URG flags set. The scan gets its name because a packet with so many flags set is thought to be lit up like a Christmas (Xmas) tree. Xmas scans may trip Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) or Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS.)

A half-open scan or TCP SYN scan is a type of port scanning technique used by attackers or security professionals to discover open ports on a target system. The purpose of a TCP SYN scan is to identify open ports on a target host. Ports are communication endpoints that allow services and applications to send and receive data over a network.

A TCP port scan is a method used to identify open, closed, or filtered TCP ports on a target system. It is a common technique employed by both security professionals and attackers to assess the security posture of a network or host. The primary purpose of a TCP port scan is to discover which TCP ports are open and listening for connections on a target system. Ports are numerical endpoints that applications use for communication over a network. 

TCP connect scans is another way to determine available ports. The attacker attempts to establish a connect with a device through the full three-way handshake. If it is successful, the port is open; if it is not, it is closed.

questions.question: You are the information security manager for Macro Inc. You are in the process of destroying old hard drives from an old server. Of the following, what document is MOST important for you to reference before proceeding?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Record retention policy

Record retention policies define what type of data to keep, the length of retention, how to maintain the data, and how to destroy the information when it is no longer needed.

An E-discovery order is a court order to maintain and not delete information relevant to a case. 

A chain of custody procedure defines how evidence should be collected and preserved to be used in court. 

A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) deals with both preparing for a disaster and aiding after a disaster has occurred. The primary goal of a BCP is to reduce disaster-related risks to an acceptable level.

questions.question: Which of the following asymmetric algorithms most likely does NOT provide encryption or key distribution?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA)

The Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA) cannot encrypt data or distribute symmetric encryption keys. DSA was published by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in 1991 as part of the Digital Signature Standard (DSS). DSA is used to authenticate or sign data and uses public and private keys.

Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC), Rivest–Shamir–Adleman (RSA), and Elgamal can all be used to encrypt data, create digital signatures, and distribute symmetric keys. Each of these three algorithms are asymmetric algorithms that utilize a public/private key combination. (This is the correct way to write the name Elgamal, according to Dr. Tajer Elgamal)

questions.question: What type of risk analysis is MOST likely to use a person's judgment or experience to assign risk?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Qualitative risk analysis

Qualitative risk analysis uses the qualities, or theories of value and risk, to evaluate risk. It is a subjective form of risk analysis. There are two main approaches to performing a risk assessment: quantitative and qualitative.

Quantitative risk analysis uses measurable values to assign value and risk. Qualitative uses a person's judgment and experience to give value and risk.

Objective and judgmental are not types of risk analysis.

questions.question:
Achen is the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for an international banking organization and is responsible for the overall security of the environment. She wants to have a better understanding of how an attacker may attack the organization, so she decides to deploy honeypots in strategic locations throughout the environment. Achen instructs her security engineers to multi-home the honeypots with a screened subnet to prevent attackers from moving laterally within the network and also asks her network team to install an Intrusion Detection System (IDS) behind the honeypots. 

After everything is set up, Achen begins to advertise the perceived vulnerabilities of the honeypot to attacker forums on the dark web, so she can observe what types of attacks they conduct. After a few months of observing the honeypots, her security team notifies him that customer account numbers have been breached. Senior management decides to hire a forensics analyst to identify the root cause of the incident. The analyst determines that one of the attackers observed by a honeypot was able to breach the network by exploiting a Structured Query Language (SQL) injection vulnerability on an online banking website. They also determine that the honeypot observed the attacker exploited a SQL injection vulnerability against the honeypot. After writing a formal report and with the approval of senior management, the analyst reports the suspected attacker to legal authorities.

Of the following, what is MOST likely the biggest mistake Achen made?

choices.text: Advertised the vulnerabilities of the honeypots to attackers
Did not report the attacker to the authorities after being observed by the honeypot
Instructed the team to multi-home the honeypots
Gives the analyst approval to report the suspected attacker to authorities

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Advertised the vulnerabilities of the honeypots to attackers

If a system owner solicits a weak system to catch an attacker, it is known as entrapment and is illegal. A honeypot is an example of an enticement system and is legal, so long as the honeypot is not solicited.

In the example above, a court may not find the attacker guilty because they could claim they were a victim of entrapment. Administrators of honeypots need to be careful not to solicit attackers into attacking a honeypot, as this is considered entrapment and is illegal.

The analyst did report to legal authorities, so the answer option did not report is a false statement. 

Multi-homing the honeypots is not a major issue. That is possibly even normal depending on where the corporation thinks the attacker may come into the network from.

questions.question: An attack that analyzes a device’s electrical emanations from a computer or server is MOST likely categorized as?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Side-channel attacks

Side-channel attacks attempt to discover sensitive information using alternative channels rather than weaknesses in the device or software itself. Examples of side-channel attacks are timing information, power consumption, electromagnetic leaks, and sound. Everything electrical has emanations that can be captured and analyzed. It is just a discharge, so the attack would not be a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attack. An MitM attack has the attacker literally in between the client and server.

A replay attack occurs when the attacker captures something like a hashed password in transmission. Then the attacker takes that hashed password and sends it to the server to see if they can get authenticated as an authorized user.

Analytic attack is not a term. It is necessary for bad actors to analyze a variety of things in their attack, it is just not the right term here.

questions.question:
An email administrator for an insurance organization has been contacted by law enforcement and informed to turn over all emails sent from one of the organization’s employees. The administrator discovers that the employee has been sending threatening emails to someone who has been reported missing.

Of the following, what type of evidence will the threatening emails MOST likely be considered to be if a trial takes place?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Circumstantial evidence

Circumstantial evidence can be used to support other evidence, but it cannot stand alone. In the scenario above, threatening emails may be used to support other circumstantial or direct evidence,so long as the prosecutor can overcome the burden of proof to ensure the emails are admissible.

Direct evidence is incorrect because it supports the truth without the need for any additional evidence. An example of this could be witness testimony to a crime. 

Conclusive evidence is incorrect because it is irrefutable and cannot be contradicted. 

Testimonial evidence is incorrect because it must be given by a witness under oath.

questions.question: In United States military organizations, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Protected Health Information (PHI) are classified as which data level?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Sensitive but unclassified

Personally identifiable information (PII) and Protected Health Information (PHI) are both classified as sensitive but unclassified. Neither PII or PHI would cause damage to national security if it were breached. It does need to be protected, but data that can cause damage to national security requires a different level of protection.

Secret, Top Secret, and Confidential are labels applied to information that, if it was disclosed, could cause damage to national security. PII and PHI does not fall in that category.

questions.question: Rashid’s boss has asked him to replace a legacy phone system with a modern secure system. One of the requirements given is that all voice conversations must be encrypted. Which of the following MEDIA sharing protocols should Rashid use to deliver encrypted voice communications?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Secure real-time transport protocol (SRTP)

Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) carries the media packets for voice or video communications over an IP-based network. RTP settings are negotiated between endpoints by the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP). Media packets can be encrypted by using the Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP). When SRTP is used, the SIP protocol generally exchanges the symmetric encryption keys between the caller and callee. To protect the keys, Transport Layer Security (TLS) is used to encrypt the SIP headers. This is sometimes referred to as SIP Secure (SIPS).

SIP Secure (SIPS) is incorrect because SIPS is used for signaling. It does not carry the actual media between each endpoint; it is used to setup the phone call connection across the network. 

Voice over Internet Protocol (IP) Protocol (VoIP) is incorrect because it is a concept, not a protocol. It is a phone call carried across the IP network. 

Transport Layer Security (TLS) is incorrect because it is not used to encrypt the RTP packets.

questions.question: Kari is a network engineer for a midsized bank. She has configured two distinct networks within her environment. To traverse from one network to the other, traffic must pass through two different firewalls managed by two different teams. Of the following, this setup is MOST likely an example of?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Defense in depth

A defense-in-depth strategy uses multiple layers or levels of access control to provide layered security. An asset can be effectively secured through various layers that an attacker would need to overcome to compromise the protected asset. An organization could use a combination of physical, logical, and technical controls and administrative access controls to create layers of protection.

The principle of least privilege is a security concept that advocates granting individuals or systems only the minimum level of access or permissions necessary to perform their authorized tasks. This principle aims to limit potential damage from accidental or malicious actions, reduce the attack surface, and minimize security risks.

A deterrent control is a security measure or strategy designed to discourage potential threats or malicious activities by dissuading attackers or unauthorized individuals from attempting to breach security measures. Unlike preventive controls that aim to stop incidents from occurring, deterrent controls focus on deterring or discouraging individuals from engaging in undesirable actions.

M of N controls means that a certain number (M) of people who are part of the group (N) who must be present when something is done. For example, a company could train eight people to access the Hardware Security Manager (HSM) on how to extract and backup crypto keys. Then, of those eight people, there must be six present anytime the HSM is actually accessed. Therefore, it would be six of eight for the M of N.

questions.question: What BEST defines the scope and enforcement of security within an organization?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security policy

A security policy is a formal document that defines the scope and enforcement of security within an organization. Security policies do not frequently change and generally invoke standards, procedures, and guidelines. Please review the following to understand the differences among these documents:

  • Policy: Defines the scope and enforcement of security within an organization
  • Standards: Mandatory rules for a given subset of technology
  • Guidelines: Recommended steps for a given subset of technology
  • Procedures: Step-by-step tasks that should be performed for a given subset of technology

questions.question: Kylie works for an international bank and is building a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system. The new SIEM system will aggregate system logs from devices across the entire environment. Of the following, what is considered to be the MOST important when aggregating system logs into a SIEM?

choices.text: Ensure system time is standardized across all devices
Ensure the clipping levels are appropriately set
Ensure alert definitions are configured to monitor for meaningful events
Ensure event processors obfuscate Personally Identifiable Information (PII)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Ensure system time is standardized across all devices

When aggregating system logs, it’s imperative that the timestamps for each log are accurate. Investigators can use Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems to review multiple device logs during a specific time window. If the system time is off or not in sync, the sequence of events may not be accurate. Administrators should enforce the use of Network Time Protocol (NTP), so all devices synchronize to a central server.

It is necessary to set the right clipping levels or thresholds. That is set within the systems that are being logged through, for example, the firewalls and Intrusion Detection System (IDS), not the SIEM.

The alert defintions need to be set in the SIEM for events that are particularly meaningful in the SIEM. This is what occurs once the logs are aggregated and analyzed by the SIEM. It is necessary to ensure the time is consistent across all the systems so that this can occur.

Obfuscation of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) protects the privacy of an individual but that is not going to assist or work against the SIEM being able to aggregate system logs correctly.

questions.question: Cruz is a software developer for an online gaming organization. After his code goes through the formal peer code review process, special software examines the uncompiled code to search for potential defects or security vulnerabilities. Of the following, what BEST describes this type of testing?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Static testing

Static testing tests the security of software without executing the software. This type of test reviews the source code and is generally done using automated tools. 

Dynamic tests are performed on running software. Dynamic testing attempts to find vulnerabilities in the running software that could be exploited by bad actors.

Fuzz testing is also performed on running software, but it is a specific type of test. Fuzz testing, also known as fuzzing, involves sending invalid, unexpected, or random data inputs to an application or system to uncover vulnerabilities, bugs, or crashes.

Interactive testing, or Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), is a test that actually combines static and dynamic testing. In IAST, the code is shown as it is accessed by the running software.

questions.question: Which of the following is LEAST likely to request an external audit to be performed?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Functional management

Functional management is busy running the business so is unlikely to request an external audit.

Unlike security assessments, security audits are typically performed by an external group to prevent conflicts of interest. These audits are generally requested by the board of directors, government regulators, or customers. The audience of a security audit report would be people outside of the company's day-to-day operations. This includes customers, especially the customer of service providers such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure cloud service.

questions.question: When discussing Transport Layer Security (TLS), which statement is MOST likely to be false?

choices.text: The server will send the pre-master secret (sometimes called the ephemeral key) encrypted with the private key to the client
The client starts the handshake by sending a Client hello message to the server
Transport Layer Security (TLS) use both asymmetric and asymmetric encryption to protect data in transit
The server responds to the client by sending a Server hello message encrypted with the private key to the client

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: The server will send the pre-master secret (sometimes called the ephemeral key) encrypted with the private key to the client

In Transport Layer Security (TLS) [formerly Secure Socket Layer (SSL)], the client is responsible for generating the pre-master secret (sometimes called the ephemeral key).

The steps for the TLS handshake are listed below:

  • Client sends a Client hello message to the Server.
  • Server sends the client a Server hello message encrypted with the private key.
  • Client decrypts the message using the public key.
  • Client sends pre-master secret (sometimes called the ephemeral key) encrypted with the public key.
  • Server decrypts the pre-master secret with the private key.
  • Both the Client and Server generate symmetric keys using the pre-master secret.
  • Symmetric encryption begins between the Client and Server.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST adds replay resistance to Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) or Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Nonce

A Nonce is a random number or value generated by the authentication server. When a client requests to authenticate, the server will reply with the Nonce; this is often called the challenge. The client will combine the Nonce with a predefined password and use a hashing algorithm to generate a response. The server will use the same Nonce and predefined password to create a hash. If the hash generated by the client and server match, the server will authenticate the client. Each Nonce can only be used once and helps prevent replay attacks.

A hashing algorithm is run against a piece of data/voice/video/password. The hashing algorithm will produce a fixed size response often called a hash or a message digest. The hashing algorithms are public. It is possible for anyone to hash a piece of data or rehash it so it does not provide any protection against replay.

A one-time pad is an encryption method. It involves a message encrypted using a unique key that is as long as the message and is never used again. One-time pads are provably unbreakable by brute force attacks. There are other methods of attack that can be successful against it though.

A cipher is another name of an encryption algorithm. These are used to protect the confidentiality of data/voice/video, especially if they are symmetric in nature.

questions.question: When disusing software development, what MOST likely describes a library?

choices.text: A collection of programming code that is used to develop software

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A collection of programming code that is used to develop software

When discussing software development, a library is a collection of programming code that is used to develop software. Software developers often use existing libraries to perform a specific function for the program being created. If a widely used open library is found to have vulnerabilities, it can affect each application that uses the library.

A database is a collection of data, most commonly today a relational database that is comprised of tables.

A memory pointer is simply that, a memory pointer. There is no special name for it.

In the context of relational databases, an index is a data structure that enhances the speed and efficiency of data retrieval operations. It works similar to an index in a book, where you can quickly locate information based on specific keywords or topics. An index in relational data helps optimize query performance by providing a quick lookup mechanism for locating rows in a table based on indexed columns.

questions.question:
The following principles are part of which security framework?

  • Provide Stakeholder Value
  • Holistic Approach
  • Dynamic Governance System
  • Governance Distinct from Management
  • Tailored to Enterprise Needs
  • End-to-End Governance System

choices.text: Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT 2019)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Risk Management Framework (RMF)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT 2019) 

Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT 2019) is a framework for governance developed by ISACA. The six COBIT 2019 principles are the following:

  • Provide Stakeholder Value
  • Holistic Approach
  • Dynamic Governance System
  • Governance Distinct from Management
  • Tailored to Enterprise Needs
  • End-to-End Governance System

 COBIT 2019 superseded COBIT 5. The five principles of COBIT 5 are the following:

  • Meeting stakeholder needs
  • Covering the enterprise end to end
  • Applying a single integrated framework
  • Enabling a holistic approach
  • Separating governance from management

NIST RMF is a guide through the process of risk management. Its phases are as follows:

  • Prepare
  • Categorize 
  • Select 
  • Implement
  • Assess 
  • Authorize
  • Monitor

ISO 27001 is used to create an Information Security Management System (ISMS), basically the whole of the security program for a corporation.

ITIL is used to manage the services that the Information Technoloy (IT) provides a corporation.

questions.question:
You are the Information Technology (IT) supervisor for a midsize manufacturing company. You discover unauthorized access permissions have been made by one of your subordinates. According to the organization’s policies, you report the unauthorized changes to the security manager. 

Your behavior is MOST likely an example of which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Due care

Due care is best defined as taking and making decisions that a reasonable and competent person would make. Due care helps shield an organization from liability should a breach happen. If an organization can prove they practiced due care, they are less likely to be found liable for the incident. In this example, you are showing due care by not deviating from company policy and acting responsibly.

It is possible that the ethical guidelines for their business says that an employee should report issues when found but that is not the best answer for this question. 

This is not an internal audit. An audit is performed by auditors, not the IT supervisor. Also an audit is a careful assessment of a particular scope of activities within the business. This is simply you, the manager, finding that one of your subordinates took actions they should not have.

questions.question: What type of data disposal method only removes the directory or catalog link to the data while leaving the original data on the drive?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Erasing

Erasing is the process of deleting a file, such as from a Windows desktop. This process does not overwrite or remove the data from the media; it only removes the file system record of the data. Erasing is not considered to be a secure method of sanitization.

Destruction is the most thorough way to ensure data cannot be recovered since it leaves the media and data unreadable and unrecoverable.  If a drive is shredded to small pieces, it would be incredibly difficult, if not impossible, to ever recover anything off the drive.

Degaussing is the process of using a powerful magnet to erase data from media. Degaussing destroys the media—it cannot be used again. The chance of recovering anything off a drive that has been degaussed is very low.

Purging is the process of erasing data in a way that it is highly unlikely that it will ever be recovered, even in a state of the art lab.

questions.question: Michelle is working with a cloud vendor that can be used in a disaster recovery scenario. She needs to ensure the vendor is contractually obligated to be available if required. Of the following, what should Michelle add as part of the agreement between her and the cloud vendor to address the availability of resources?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Service Level Agreement (SLA)

A Service Level Agreement (SLA) is a contractual agreement between the customer and the vendor that outlines the expected level of expected service. If the vendor cannot fulfill the SLA, the customer can often be reimbursed or nullify the contract.

A Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) is a legal contract between parties that outlines confidential information shared and prohibits the recipient from disclosing or using the information without authorization, protecting sensitive data.

Terms and conditions refer to the rules and agreements that govern the use of a service or product. They outline rights, responsibilities, limitations, and legal obligations for users and providers.

A reciprocal agreement is a mutual understanding or arrangement between two or more parties where each agrees to provide benefits or services to the other in exchange for similar benefits or services. It involves a give-and-take relationship based on mutual cooperation and understanding. In information security this is used as a type of disaster recovery site.

questions.question: Which of the following is most likely NOT the responsibility of the data custodian?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Determines who accesses data

Data owners are in charge of determining who has access, establishing the rules of appropriate behavior, assisting in identifying additional security controls.

Data custodians are responsible for maintaining and protecting the data and ensuring its availability for the data owner. They are also responsible for backing up data and modifying data access as required by the data owner.

questions.question: Of the following, which encryption method most likely does NOT provide end-to-end encryption?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA)

Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) is considered hop-to-hop or Link encryption because the network frame is only protected between the client and the wireless access point.

Secure Shell (SSH), HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS), and File Transfer Protocol Secure (FTPS) provide end-to-end encryption. The encryption is negotiated between the client and server and does not rely on lower-layer encryption methods to protect the payload.

questions.question: When discussing the Common Criteria, what Evaluation Assurance Level (EAL) is considered to be methodically designed, tested, and reviewed?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: EAL4

The Common Criteria for Information Technology Security was developed as a standard for evaluating information technology products and has seven levels.

  • EAL1: Functionally tested
  • EAL2: Structurally tested
  • EAL3: Methodically tested and checked
  • EAL4: Methodically designed, tested, and reviewed
  • EAL5: Semi-formally designed and tested
  • EAL6: Semi-formally verified designed and tested
  • EAL7: Formally verified designed and tested

questions.question: When discussing Kerberos, what must a subject already have to request a service ticket?

choices.text: The public key of the key distribution center

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A ticket-granting ticket

A Ticket-Granting Ticket (TGT) provides proof that a subject has already been authenticated through a Key Distribution Center (KDC) and is authorized to request service tickets. A TGT is encrypted and can only be decrypted by the KDC. Subjects present the TGT to the KDC when requesting service tickets that provide access to other network resources.

Kerberos does not use asymmetric cryptography, so there are no public keys found anywhere within the KDC.

A session key is issued after the subject requests a ticket. So first the subject must have a TGT.

There is no pre-master secret found within Kerberos.

questions.question: Of the following, what protocol or standard is LEAST likely to be used in a Single Sign-On (SSO) deployment?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Challenge handshake authentication protocol (CHAP)

Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) is one of the authentication protocols used over PPP links. CHAP hashes usernames and passwords to prevent them from being transmitted in cleartext. It performs authentication using a challenge-response that is resistant to replay attacks. CHAP is not generally used for Single Sign-On (SSO) deployments.

Kerberos, Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML), and Open IDentification (OpenID) are all commonly used in SSO deployments. Kerberos is used within a Local Area Network within a corporation. SAML and OpenID are commonly used for web SSO.

questions.question:
In 2019 and 2020, hackers successfully injected malicious code into a product named Orion created by SolarWinds. By injecting malicious code into an otherwise legitimate product, the hackers could infiltrate hundreds of organizations and government agencies from around the globe that were actively using Orion to manage their IT infrastructure. 

This attack can BEST be described as what?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Supply chain attack

A supply chain attack exploits an organization's trust in another organization to supply them with a product, service, or materials. Organizations often fail to build and maintain comprehensive supply chain risk management programs. Some of the most impactful and elaborate cybersecurity attacks were supply chain attacks. It is becoming more critical than ever to require an organization's suppliers to meet an acceptable level of security to reduce the likelihood of a supply chain attack. The US government is beginning to require that all defense contractors meet a minimum level of cybersecurity requirements that will be audited. These requirements must also be flowed to all downstream and upstream suppliers of the organization that wins the contract.

Below are some famous supply chain attacks:

  • 2013 Target Credit Card disclosure. Attackers exploited a third-party HVAC company that Target used. The HVAC company had devices on the Target corporate network that attackers exploited to gain access to Target's network.
  • As previsouly mentioned, 2019 and 2020 SolarWinds Orion attack. Attackers injected code into a trusted product that was widely deployed.
  • 2021 Kaseya VSA attack. VSA is a product used by IT companies to manage their customers' computers and systems. Attackers were able to exploit VSA and gain access to the customers' computer networks.

A ransomware attack is a type of malicious software (malware) attack that encrypts files or locks access to a victim's computer system or data with the attacker demanding payment (a ransom) to restore access. Ransomware attacks are typically carried out by cybercriminals seeking financial gain and can have devastating consequences for individuals, businesses, and organizations.

A zero-day attack is a cyberattack that exploits a previously unknown vulnerability in software or hardware for which no patch or fix is available. The term zero-day refers to the fact that the vulnerability is exploited on the same day it becomes known to the public or to the software vendor, giving them zero days to respond or provide a fix.

An integrity attack, also known as data tampering, is a type of cyberattack that aims to modify, alter, or corrupt data in a way that compromises its integrity. The goal of such attacks is often to manipulate data to achieve unauthorized changes, cause confusion, or undermine trust in the integrity of the information. Integrity attacks can have severe consequences, including data breaches, financial loss, reputational damage, and regulatory non-compliance.

questions.question: Bulan is the Information Technology (IT) operations manager and has received approval from the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) to conduct a full-interruption test. Of the following, what is Bulan MOST likely to do?

choices.text: Shut down data processing operations at the main datacenter and move them to the recovery site
Gather the disaster recovery team in a conference room and role-play a disaster scenario
Instruct the disaster recovery team to relocate personnel to the recovery site and begin implementing site activation procedures
Gather the disaster recovery team in a conference room and review the Business Continuity Plan (BCP) to identify potential gaps or oversights

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Shut down data processing operations at the main datacenter and move them to the recovery site

Full-interruption tests are similar to parallel tests, except they involve the actual shutdown of operations at the main site and moving to the recovery site. These tests are extremely costly and risky due to the complete shutdown of operations at the main site.

A structured walk-through is when the disaster recovery team gathers in a conference room and does a role-play of a disaster. 

A simulation test is when the disaster recovery team is presented with a disaster scenario and is asked to come up with a response and then that response is tested. 

A parallel test is when the disaster recovery team relocates personnel to the recovery site and implements site activation procedures.

questions.question: Your organization classifies all data and assigns a clearance to every user. The clearance of the user and the classification of the data is mapped to the security policy to determine if the user should be granted acces. Of the following, what access control model does your organization MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory access control (MAC)

A system that employs Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classifications and labels to define user access. Every resource is classified with a label, and users cannot access resources unless they have an equal or greater clearance level. MAC is widely used in government and military environments. MAC is often referred to as a lattice-based model because it looks like a garden lattice with well-defined boundaries when it is represented on paper.

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) allows the data owner to control and define access to objects. 

Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) maps a subject’s role with their needed operations and tasks. 

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) makes decisions based on attributes for either the subject, object, or actions.

questions.question: Martha has been hired to assess an organization's website for vulnerabilities. She wants to perform an automated scan to speed up the process. Of the following tools, what will Martha MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Nessus

Nessus is a popular web vulnerability scanning tool. It is a special-purpose tool that searches web applications for known vulnerabilities. It plays an important role in a security testing program because it can discover flaws that may not be visible to a network vulnerability scanner.

Cain and Abel is a password cracking program. 

Metasploit is an open-source penetration testing framework that helps security professionals simulate attacks, test defenses, and discover vulnerabilities in computer systems, networks, and applications. Developed by Rapid7, Metasploit provides a comprehensive set of tools, exploits, payloads, and modules for conducting security assessments and penetration testing. 

Nmap, short for Network mapper, is a popular open-source network scanning tool used by security professionals and network administrators to discover hosts, services, and vulnerabilities on computer networks. It operates by sending packets to target hosts and analyzing their responses to gather information about the network.

While the CISSP test will not ask about products like these, it can be useful to know that programs like these exist. The questions could be vendor or product generic. However, these names here make it easier to research and learn about these products.

questions.question:
Josie is a penetration tester who has been hired to assess an internal website. She provides the following input for the username field:

1,UNION SELECT 1,current_user();- -

This is MOST likely an example of what type of attack?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Structured Query Language (SQL) injection

Structured Query Language (SQL) injection attacks happen when an application interface does not properly validate input. This allows an attacker to send SQL commands as application input and manipulate or alter data within the database.

Directory traversal is a security exploit where an attacker manipulates input to navigate outside the intended directory structure of a web application. By using special characters like ../, they can access sensitive files or directories on the server.

Command injection is a security vulnerability that occurs when an attacker injects malicious commands into an application's input fields or parameters. This can happen in web applications, command-line interfaces, or any system that processes user input. If the application does not properly validate or sanitize input, the attacker can execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system or application environment.

SQL injection targets databases by injecting malicious SQL code, while command injection targets operating systems or applications by injecting malicious commands. Both exploit lack of input validation but affect different components (database versus operating system).

Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) is a type of security vulnerability commonly found in web applications. It occurs when attackers inject malicious scripts (typically, JavaScript) into web pages viewed by other users. This allows the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the victim's browser, potentially compromising user data, stealing cookies or performing unauthorized actions on behalf of the user.

There are three main types of XSS attacks:

  • Reflected XSS: In this type of attack, the malicious script is injected into the URL or a form input, and the server reflects it back in the response without proper validation or encoding. When the victim clicks on a crafted link or submits a form, the script executes in their browser.
  • Stored XSS: Also known as persistent XSS, this attack involves injecting malicious scripts into a vulnerable web application's database, typically through user-generated content like comments or forum posts. When other users access the page containing the injected script, it executes in their browsers.
  • DOM-based XSS: This type of XSS occurs when client-side scripts manipulate the Document Object Model (DOM) based on user input, leading to script execution in the browser. Unlike traditional XSS, the malicious payload is not sent to the server but directly affects the DOM on the client side.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid step in the creation of a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) as established by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in SP 800-34?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Create threat models for critical systems

Creating threat models for critical systems is not a valid step as outlined by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). Threat modeling would be normal information security terminology. It is not a term used in BCP. It is a risk assessment to determine what threats a system is susceptible to or what level of skill an attacker would need to be successful in exploiting a particular threat.

NIST outlines the following steps in SP 800-34:

  1. Develop the contingency planning policy statement: A formal policy provides the authority and guidance necessary to develop an effective contingency plan.
  2. Conduct the Business Impact Analysis (BIA): The BIA helps identify and prioritize information systems and components critical to supporting the organization's mission/business functions. A template for developing the BIA is provided to assist the user.
  3. Identify preventive controls: Measures taken to reduce the effects of system disruptions can increase system availability and reduce contingency lifecycle costs.
  4. Create contingency strategies: Thorough recovery strategies ensure that the system may be recovered quickly and effectively following a disruption.
  5. Develop an information system contingency plan: The contingency plan should contain detailed guidance and procedures for restoring a damaged system unique to the system's security impact level and recovery requirements.
  6. Ensure plan testing, training, and exercises: Testing validates recovery capabilities, whereas training prepares recovery personnel for plan activation and exercising the plan identifies planning gaps; combined, the activities improve plan effectiveness and overall organization preparedness.
  7. Ensure plan maintenance: The plan should be a living document that is updated regularly to remain current with system enhancements and organizational changes.

questions.question: Jocelyn has been hired to conduct an external security assessment for a national bank. After the initial discovery phase of the assessment, she runs a Nmap scan to find possible services exposed to the internet. Of the following, which result is MOST likely to be a concern?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 3389 Transmission Control Protocol open

Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 3389 is the standard port for Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). Generally, RDP should not be exposed to the internet unless only specific external IP addresses are allowed.

TCP port 80 is used for HTTP traffic. TCP port 443 is used for HTTPS traffic. UDP port 123 is used for the Network Time Protocol (NTP).

questions.question: You are a software security assessor and want to test if it’s possible to execute privileged commands by sending carefully crafted and abnormally large amounts of data as input for specific software. Of the following, what type of attack are you testing for?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Buffer overflow attack

Buffer overflows occur when an application does not validate input data length. They occur when too much data is provided, and the allocated memory space overflows. This generally causes the program to crash, and in some circumstances, the attacker can replace legitimate code execution with their own set of instructions.

Fuzzing is not an attack so much as a way to test an application. Fuzzing, also known as fuzz testing or fuzzing, is a software testing technique used to discover vulnerabilities and bugs in software applications by providing invalid, unexpected, or random input to the application. The goal of fuzzing is to identify potential security flaws, crashes, or unexpected behavior caused by input validation errors or boundary condition failures.

A birthday attack is a statistical phenomenon in cryptography and computer science that exploits the mathematics of probability to find collisions in hash functions more efficiently than brute force methods. It is named after the birthday paradox, which states that in a group of just 23 people, there is a better than even chance that two people will share the same birthday.

A memory mapping attack, also known as a memory-mapping file attack, is a type of security exploit that takes advantage of the memory-mapping functionality in operating systems to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information or execute malicious code.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST likely the default port for Secure Shell (SSH)?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 22

Secure Shell (SSH) uses port 22.

Telnet uses port 23. File Transfer Protocol (FTP) uses ports 20 and 21. Domain Name System (DNS) uses port 53.

questions.question:
Donna works as an accountant for an insurance company. Her IT department has configured the organization's network switches to authenticate each device that connects to the network. When Donna attempts to connect to the network, the switch forwards her device credentials to an authentication server. The server accepts the credentials and sends a reply to the switch, instructing it to allow the device to connect.

Of the following, what protocol is the authentication server MOST likely running?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS)

Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) centralizes authentication for remote connections. RADIUS has three components: the client or user, the RADIUS client, and the RADIUS server. The client/user will send their credentials to the RADIUS client. The RADIUS client will forward those credentials to the RADIUS server and wait for a reply. The RADIUS server will reply with the authorization of the client/user. The RADIUS client will grant or deny access based on the response from the RADIUS server.

RADIUS is generally used by network equipment to grant or deny access to network resources. It is frequently found in applications like 802.1X. RADIUS also provides accounting for each request, so all requests are tracked.

Kerberos is a network authentication protocol that enables secure communication over an untrusted network. It uses tickets for authentication, allowing clients and servers to verify each other's identities without transmitting sensitive information across the network.

Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an XML-based protocol used for exchanging authentication and authorization data between identity providers, service providers, and clients. It enables Single Sign-On (SSO) and secure access to web applications.

802.1X is a network access control protocol that provides authentication to devices trying to connect to a network. It requires devices to authenticate before gaining access, ensuring only authorized users and devices can access the network resources. 802.1X combines Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) and RADIUS and is commonly used with wireless networks.

questions.question:
A manufacturing organization is undergoing a security audit. The auditor wants to test if an attacker can access the network from a switch in one of the wiring closets. The auditor successfully gained access to the organization's network with no assistance by connecting a device to the switch.

Of the following, what will the auditor MOST likely recommend to prevent future attacks against the organization's network switches?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Physically secure the wiring closet

Wiring closets are the central storage areas for hardware, including routers, switches, cables, patch panels, and (sometimes) computer equipment. Wiring closets should be secured using physical security such as locks, swipe card access on the doors, and video surveillance. Network and facilities personnel should lock all network equipment to prevent unauthorized individuals from accessing it.

802.1X, 802.1AE, and disabling unused network interfaces are all good practices to do in addition to physically securing the wiring closet. 

The Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE) 802.1x is an authentication protocol that uses Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) and Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS). 

IEEE 802.1AE "specifies provision of connectionless user data confidentiality, data integrity, and data origin authenticity by media access independent protocols and entities that operate transparently to MAC Clients," according to the IEEE. Both IEEE 802.1X and IEEE 802.1AE are not helpful in preventing future attacks against the network switch if the attacker can gain access to the closet, as in the question. 

Disabling unused network interfaces are helpful, but if the attacker can get their hands on the actual switch, this will not stop the attacker from connecting to the administrator's interface or unplugging a device from a used port and using that for themselves.

questions.question: When discussing cryptography, which BEST describes Zero-Knowledge Proof?

choices.text: It allows one party to prove to another party that they know a value without disclosing any part of that value
When a random number or value is generated by an authentication server to prevent replay attacks
A concept that ensures that the subject of an activity or event cannot deny that the event occurred
When a system authenticates a subject by comparing two hash values

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: It allows one party to prove to another party that they know a value without disclosing any part of that value

Zero-Knowledge Proof is the concept that a subject can be authenticated or verified without disclosing any part of the value that they use to verify themselves. A typical example of this is digital signatures. When a subject is authenticated using a digital signature, the private key is never disclosed even though it verifies their identity. The verifier decrypts a value that could only have been encrypted using the private key. If the verifier can decrypt the value using the public key, the sender must have the private key.

A random number or value generated by an authentication server to prevent replay attacks goes by a few names, one is the NONCE. A NONCE is a Number used ONCE. NONCEs are seen within the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol. When working with passwords, a random number is used to protect them better than just hashing them. This is called a salt. A salt is a random number that is combined with the password before it is hashed.

If a subject cannot deny the activity or event, it is called non-repudiation. To repudiate is to deny or argue, so non-repudiation is when the subject cannot deny. If a user can be shown to have done something in particular because:

  1. the action is captured on a video recording showing them talking through what they are doing, 
  2. with witnesses present, and
  3. digitally signing a document 

then there are multiple pieces of evidence that prove that the user took that action they can no longer deny that they are the source of the damage.

A system authenticates a subject when it compares the hash value it received to the stored hash value to determine if the subject typed in the correct password.

questions.question: Padma is the security manager for a manufacturing organization. She has identified a risk. However, reducing the risk to an acceptable level is more expensive than if the risk is realized. In this scenario, what risk response strategy should Padma employ?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Risk acceptance

When risk mitigation is more expensive than if the risk is realized, an organization should document and accept the risk or rethink its mitigation strategy. Risk acceptance does not mean choosing to ignore the risk but, rather, concluding that doing something about the risk is more costly than the risk itself.

Risk transfer (or risk sharing) is when the person or company that is responsible for a particular risk involves another in the process of responding to the event of the threat being realized behind that risk. The most common example of risk transfer is the purchase of insurance. There may be an initial payment that must be made by the person or company responsible for the risk before the insurance company completes the payment. Or it is even possible the insurance company will not assist because the responsible party did not take the correct actions before the incident or were actually at fault for the incident.

Risk avoidance is the action, or non-action, that has a responsible party not engage in a particular activity because it is beyond the risk level that they are willing to accept, even with controls added. Risk avoidance also includes the stopping of behavior once the responsible party realizes how risky a particular activity is.

Risk mitigation (or risk reduction) is the process of adding security controls that will minimize the likelihood or the impact of a particular threat being realized.

questions.question: When discussing Structured Query Language (SQL) injection, what is MOST likely used to prevent an application from running commands directly against the SQL server?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Input validation

Input validation is a crucial aspect of software development that involves checking and ensuring the correctness, completeness, and security of data entered into a system by users or external sources. It is possible to detect all SQL commands. This would then allow the software to see the SQL command and delete it.

A stored procedure is a pre-programmed set of Structured Query Language (SQL) commands that are stored on the SQL server, not the client application. Stored procedures use sent arguments from the client as inputs. SQL server administrators can use stored procedures to limit what commands users and applications can execute.

Open DataBase Connectivity (ODBC) is an Application Programming Interface (API) designed to standardize communication between DataBase Management Systems (DBMS) and applications. It provides a way for applications to send SQL queries and commands to databases and retrieve results.

Tokenization is a process of replacing sensitive data elements, such as credit card numbers or Personal Identification Numbers (PINs), with non-sensitive tokens. These tokens are randomly generated strings or numbers that have no intrinsic meaning or value outside of the specific context in which they are used.

Fuzzing, also known as fuzz testing or fuzz analysis, is a software testing technique that involves sending random or malformed data inputs to a target application to uncover vulnerabilities, crashes, or unexpected behavior.

questions.question: Which of the following vulnerabilities MOST likely only impacts Secure Sockets Layer (SSL)?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption (POODLE)

Transport Layer Security (TLS) standard was created to replace the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) standard, which was in its third version. In 2014, an attack known as the padding oracle on downgraded legacy encryption (POODLE) demonstrated a significant flaw in the SSL 3.0 fallback mechanism. SSL is considered insecure and should be replaced by a new version of TLS.

Heartbleed is incorrect because it affects TLS and SSL. KRACK is incorrect because it affects wireless connections. EternalBlue is incorrect because it affects Microsoft Windows Server Message Block (SMB) connections.

questions.question: You are testing for potential security flaws in a software design that could allow a user to manipulate the software negatively. Of the following, what type of testing will MOST likely find these flaws?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Misuse case testing

Misuse case testing is used to help identify potential security flaws in a software's design by examining how software could be abused or manipulated into doing something malicious.

Interface testing is incorrect because it specifically examines a software's interfaces, such as Application Programming Interface (API), Graphical User Interface (GUI), and physical interface. 

Static testing is incorrect because it tests the security of software without executing the software and generally reviews the source code and is done using automated tools. 

Black box testing is incorrect because it's performed by someone with no knowledge of the program's inter-workings.

questions.question: Mitch has been hired to conduct a penetration test against a national bank. He wants to test the effectiveness of the bank’s Data Loss Prevention (DLP) program. Of the following, what technique or technology is he MOST likely to use?

choices.text: Use of Alternate Data Streams (ADS) within a file system

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Steganography

Steganography is used to hide data inside of an image file. It is a common method used to bypass Data Loss Prevention (DLP) engines and is difficult to detect. Steganography works by modifying the least significant bits of the image to embed data into the image. Of these four options it is the best to answer this question.

Fuzzing, also known as fuzz testing or fuzzing, is a software testing technique used to discover vulnerabilities and bugs in software applications by providing invalid, unexpected, or random input to the application. The goal of fuzzing is to identify potential security flaws, crashes, or unexpected behavior caused by input validation errors or boundary condition failures.

Data serialization is the process of converting structured data, such as objects or data structures in programming languages, into a format that can be easily stored, transmitted, or persisted to disk. Serialization allows data to be represented as a sequence of bytes or characters, which can then be reconstructed into its original form (deserialized) when needed.

Alternate Data Streams (ADS) is a feature found in some file systems, notably the New Technology File System (NTFS) used in Windows operating systems. ADS allows additional data to be associated with a file or directory beyond the main data stream.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST likely to be considered the strongest authentication factor?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Type 3

Type 3 authentication is something you are. An example of a type 3 factor is a retina scan or palm vein scan. All authentication factors have weaknesses and should be combined to create Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

Type 1 is something you know like a password, which is not as secure as a retina scan. Type 2 is something you have like a smartcard or security token, which is not considered as secure as a retina scan.

There is no type 4 factor.

questions.question: If implemented correctly, what cipher or class of cipher is MOST likely to be considered unbreakable by brute force?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: One-time pad

Gilbert Vernam invented the One-Time Pad (OTP) in 1917, and it is sometimes referred to as the Vernam cipher. One-time pad requires a completely random key that is the same length as the message. Each bit of the message and the key are eXclusive-OR (XOR) together. The resulting ciphertext is considered unbreakable by brute force (it is suseptible to other attack methods) as long as the key remains secure. For a one-time pad to be implemented correctly, keys cannot be reused and must truly be random.

The following are one-time pad requirements:

  • Keys must be genuinely random values.
  • Keys can only be used one time.
  • Keys must be exchanged securely.
  • The sender and receiver must keep the keys secure.
  • The key must be the same length as the message.

Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) 256 is a commonly used symmetric algorithm. Brute force will work; it is simply a matter of time and computing resources. There are a limited number of key options. The number is 2256.

A running key cipher is similar to a one-time pad. If the key is generated to match the requirements above, then this is a one-time pad. However, with the term running key cipher, the requirement to only use the key once is not a requirement. This is where this becomes attackable. Repetition anywhere within a cryptographic algorithm and its implementation introduces the likelihood of a successful attack.

The Vigenère cipher is a polyalphabetic substitution cipher that uses a keyword to encrypt and decrypt messages. It was invented by Blaise de Vigenère in the 16th century and is considered more secure than simple substitution ciphers like the Caesar cipher. However, it is not secure at all today. It is absolutely breakable.

questions.question: A process in which management directs an organization to reduce residual risk to an acceptable level set by senior management is BEST called?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Governance

Governance is how management directs an organization to reduce residual risk to an acceptable level set by senior management. Governance must involve oversight to ensure that the goals set by senior management have been met. When performing security governance, Information Technology (IT) managers need to keep security objectives in alignment with business objectives.

A Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is a systematic process used to evaluate and assess the potential impacts of disruptions or incidents on an organization's critical business functions. It identifies and prioritizes these functions based on their importance to the organization's operations and objectives.

A security assessment is a systematic evaluation of an organization's security posture to identify vulnerabilities, risks, and potential threats. It involves analyzing security controls, policies, procedures, and technical implementations to assess their effectiveness in protecting assets and mitigating security risks.

The trickle-down effect is an economic theory suggesting that benefits given to the wealthy or upper class will eventually trickle down to the lower classes. This theory posits that tax breaks, subsidies, and other advantages for the wealthy will lead to increased investment, job creation, and economic growth, benefiting everyone in society. However, critics argue that this theory often fails to materialize in practice, as wealth concentration among the wealthy may not necessarily result in widespread economic benefits for all segments of society.

questions.question: Which of the following MOST likely describes configuration management?

choices.text: Ensures secure baselines on systems are adequately maintained
Documents how changes will be monitored and controlled
Identifies vulnerabilities and steps to mitigate the risks associated with them
Ensures that systems are current on patches and up to date

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Ensures secure baselines on systems are adequately maintained

Configuration management is used to ensure secure baselines on systems are adequately maintained, and any deviations are authorized and documented. Configuration management seeks to establish safe, reliable configurations for systems.

A change management plan is a generic plan that documents how changes will be monitored and controlled. It defines the process for managing changes in the project. 

A vulnerability management plan identifies vulnerabilities and steps to mitigate the risks associated with them. 

A patch management plan ensures that systems are current on patches and up to date.

questions.question:
Sam is the security manager for his organization and has approval from senior management to test an internal plan that seeks to continue operations in a natural disaster. His plan includes off-site office space, methods to maintain critical communication lines, and data-center failover capabilities.

Of the following, what type of plan is Sam MOST likely to test?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Business Continuity Plan (BCP)

A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) is a series of procedures and plans that help an organization maintain operations in a long-term disaster. They are often confused with Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP) but differ in their scope. A BCP is generally focused on the business as a whole, whereas a DRP is generally focused on critical IT infrastructure and processes. A BCP and DRP are used together to recover from and maintain operations during a disaster.

Incident Response Plan (IRP) is incorrect because it focuses on an organization's response to a suspected security event. Crisis Communications Plan (CCP) is incorrect because it focuses on maintaining communications during a disaster.

questions.question: Of the following, which algorithm is NOT considered to be a block cipher?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Rivest Cipher 4 (RC4)

Rivest Cipher 4 (RC4) is a stream cipher and has a variable key size. It was commonly used in Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP); however, it is no longer considered secure.

DES, RC5, and RC6 are all block ciphers.

questions.question: Morgen works as an accountant for a large bank and can only access resources and perform tasks that are directly related to her job role. What type of access control model does Morgen’s organization MOST likely use?
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Role-based access control

A system that employs Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) maps a subject’s role with their needed operations and tasks. Users are assigned roles and not resources.

Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classification and clearances to define user access based on the corporate policy. 

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) allows the data owner to control and define access to objects. 

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) makes decisions based on attributes or characteristics for either the subject, object, or actions.

questions.question: When discussing Information Technology (IT) security, what BEST describes the purpose of integrity?

choices.text: Ensures the accuracy and reliability of data and systems
Provides a mechanism that authorizes subjects access to objects
Adds a reasonable level of confidence in an individual's trustworthiness

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Ensures the accuracy and reliability of data and systems

Integrity ensures the accuracy and reliability of data and systems. The purpose of integrity is to maintain confidence that data is accurate and has not been modified by unauthorized users. Integrity mechanisms include authentication, authorization, accounting (AAA), hashing, and digital signatures.

Prevents the unauthorized disclosure of information is a confidentiality definition.

Provides a mechanism that authorizes subject access to objects is the topic of authentication.

Adds a reasonable level of confidence in an individual’s trustworthiness could be seen as ethics.

questions.question: Ruairi’s manager has asked him to conduct a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) as a prerequisite for creating the Business Continuity Plan (BCP). Of the following, what is MOST likely the purpose of conducting the Business Impact Analysis (BIA)?

choices.text: Identify critical systems and prioritize assets that are most critical to the business
Determine the best solution to ensure critical assets are always available
Decide which systems will be protected by a hot site and which will be protected by a warm site

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Identify critical systems and prioritize assets that are most critical to the business

A Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is used to help identify critical systems and prioritize assets that are most critical to the business. The BIA also identifies organizational risks. Identifying risks allows the business to understand the risk and security needed for a specific system. It also assigns priority and asset value to a system to help determine costs associated with implementing the additional controls.

Estimating profit or loss is a topic for the accountants. BIA is a security process.

After the BIA has been completed, the team will know which systems are critical business functions as well as how long they can be offline if a disaster occurs. That enables them to move to the next step, which is to strategize the right solutions for their systems. This encompasses two of the answer answers: 1) Determine the best solution to ensure critical assets are always available and 2) Decide which systems will be protected by a hot site and which will be protected by a warm site.
